Reviews.Title: “wouldnt stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Claire J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room was like it hadnt seen any update for a very long time . the duvets were yellow from age and no more than the thickness of a blanket. no pillow, piece of foam under a sheet. mice staying there were im sure a lot more comfortable. although internet access is advertised, it didnt work. no use of any phone even at a charge. room smelt ant in general not good.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: Marina B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: we have arrived at night. Lobby was full with some strange looking persons, who were making noise till early morning. Since our room was round the corner could not sleep. It was very cold in the room and smelling with tobacco. Shower is connected to the toilet and you have to pass a huge pool fu.ll of water from the shower to get to the toilet. Previous payment with credit card was not accepted even though i was informed bythe bank that money were paid, local terminal was broken, i had to find cash in the night to pay for the room and digital key as well. Location is in the center but you can see only trash from the window. Breakfast is next door, it's acceptable. But a person at the reception refused to give breakfast vaucher to my 8years old son who was paid for the bed and breakfast, fortunately, in the morning problem was solved. So, my grade is disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: trippuertorico Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice location. Maybe more comfortable bed matress. I would stay here again. Service was good. Cleanliness is important, so it was nice to see you complied.

Reviews.Title: “double room 212”
Reviews.Author: ernesto s Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room is more than basic . they asked 100â‚¬ per night. Breakfast is not in the same location but in a bar close to main entrance. Definitely not a good place to stay, evenfor a night . Poor and decadent.

Reviews.Title: “BAD 403 ROOM”
Reviews.Author: mekni d Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very bad hotel and expensive 260 euros for 4 night. the room at the 4 floor whithout lift , no bathroom ,no television small bed. only the three good things it s the cleaners rooms a young very nice hungarian girl and the second thing is internet free at the desk of the hotel but not very speed and very central hotel for the visit. i am not looking for luxery hotel but the room was terrible and the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean, mice and rodenticide”
Reviews.Author: Julian D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms were not clean. Toothpaste stains on the sink; sink itself broken in several places. Shower with only either boiling or ice cold water, in fact only dribbles of water - low water pressure. Mattresses saggy, and full of hairs. In the night we were woken by a mouse. The next morning we discovered rat poison (powder) directly under one of the beds - 20 cm from the pillow. We made a picture which we showed to the receptionist, who more or less just shrugged it off.

Reviews.Title: “You can try”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is amazing regarding the price, and services are globally ok. We would have liked better beds, mine was almost destroyed Employees are neither nice nor mean, just doing their job.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Manofa hotel overall is good for money you pay. It's really cheap, but don't expect much of it. The location is the best advantage of this hotel, very center of Amsterdam. Included breakfast wasn't bad as well.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed... but not how you'd think!”
Reviews.Author: Shane_Sabrina
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of 8 lads who chose to stay here for a football Euro away... Amsterdam is an expensive place, so when we saw the Manofa and how cheap it was.. then we were ready to take it on.. rats an' all! We considered it to be a good laugh to book in here... as a couple of the lads are scared of mice.. so we could have a great time watching them panic... Anyhow.. we stayed 2 nights... not a single mouse to be seen... and obviously there were no rats seen... simply because some of the previous reviewers seem to not know the difference between a mouse and rat. We arrived early in the morning and book in was at 2pm, so we were allowed to leave our bags and head off for a few pints. We booked in on two floors, I was in a room of 3 in room 220, and the rest of our group had a large balcony room on the third floor. The rooms were very dated, but clean enough, the corridors and paintwork is tired and shabby and there are little bits of graffiti around the place.. that makes it feel much more like a hostel than a hotel. The bathroom was clean too, the showers were hot, the rooms were lovely and warm and the beds were really soft and comfy... The lads were bemused with me, as I had promised them a right old rough and ready place with mice scurrying about... but sadly all I had provided them with, was a proper bargain and a comfy stay.. oh and a breakfast thrown in too... a nice bit of cheese and ham went down a treat on a bit of toast. So to summarise... would I put my parents up in this hotel? Well.. no... Would my missus be happy if I took her though... hmm.. maybe.. and would a stag party/hen party enjoy this place that is bang in the best location, but mega cheap to stay... oh yes! They say you get what you pay... well we certainly did well for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, mouse hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Yllka L
Reviews.Content: I would like to share with you a terrible experience of staying at this hotel, it was dirty, bad smelling and what is most important it was a shelter for mouses..Nobody told us that we have to share our room with mouses, and that none of the windows in the room can't close and it was freezing...You can see live mouses runing in the room especially during the night...please don''t choose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “This is a S**t box of a place”
Reviews.Author: CONOR H
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE Buy a tent, sleep in a field but not here! Pure dung heap of a so called hotel, absolutely stinking, 3 bloody blind mice and 3000 cousins running the hotel and stealing everyones dope and McDonalds. Not suitable for any type of person, not stag do's, not hen parties, this place should be be condemned. Eventually, myself and my 2 mates, who were there for a long weekend could stand it no longer and just packed our bags and went to the pub....there were no rooms available anywhere....stayed in pub till 4am and got taxi to a nice airport hotel for a wash and sleep....so NEVER BOOK THIS HOLE

Reviews.Title: “Rats have eaten our breakfast. 2 space cakes !”
Reviews.Author: Giannis G
Reviews.Content: We had 2 space cakes ready for breakfast from the nearby coffeshop and this was lunch for rats unfortunately !! I attach a foto of the rats traps. You will find them under your beds...

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!! They have mice! Utter nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: calgarygirl1980
Reviews.Content: The only way I can describe our experience was an utter nightmare. I would never wish anyone to stay here. My family of 5 stayed on the 4th floor in the "5 bed" room which was nothing but bunk beds (and no elevator. we had to drag our luggage 3 flights of windy, narrow stairs). All the rooms smelled like MJ- it was disgusting. The bathrooms were smelly and small. One of the doors to a bathroom didn't lock. None of us could shower. To top it all off, we had mice running around our room at night! They even got into our luggage. They had a sign on the door saying no outside food- but didn't tell us about the mice! It was horrible. We had to keep the lights on all night and none of us slept. Please please don't book here. The location isn't worth getting the worst night of your life. This is not a sanitary hotel- its a very dirty, mice infested hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty and noisy”
Reviews.Author: nz_chick27
Reviews.Content: Only stayed in this hotel for one night at the end of our trip Negatives: The room was very dirty, marks on the walls, sheets unclean, smelt. The smell of people smoking in the alleyway stunk out our room, The shop downstairs had loud pumping music all day, only turned off around 9pm, back on again at 9am. The lock on the toilet in the hallway didn't work so had to have my partner stand guard each time I wanted to go. The toilet was dirty and stunk of pot. The shower door had a gap about 20cm long at the bottom so anyone could nosey in at you having a shower (I didn't have a shower). The lock on the room door was very fustrating, had to yank very hard on the door to close it properly so it locked, then put my shoulder into it to open it again. Positives: The location was fantasic, especially as it was hard finding public toilets in Amsterdam, we could just pop back to the hotel to use the loo. The breakfast in the morning was a buffet downstairs. Over all, I would never stay in this hotel again. Would prefer to pay a little bit extra to go somewhere that's clean and has privacy and security.

Reviews.Title: “the worst place i have ever stayed!!”
Reviews.Author: stephanie l
Reviews.Content: if i could rate negative figure i would give -100. the worst hotel i have ever stayed. i don't understand they could call themselves a hotel. it was not a place for human to stay. i could easily write out at least 10 disappointments that we concluded during our stays. receptionists were ok, but not very helpful. they put us in a room on the ground floor. 1. noise from the pub down stair, they said the pub will close at 10pm. ok...however at night time we could hear other guests walked up and down stairs. as our room was under the staircase. 2. we found holes on the wall and on the ceiling. (nothing match to the picture they put up on the websites) 3. rain was leaking from the ceiling, the floor was wet. 4. door knob came off when we were trying to close our room door. 5. no cupboard or any other hangers for clothes 6. no bins, no paper provided. 7. bed sheets, pillow cases, duvet covers and towels were like they never clean, dirty marks everywhere. 8. walls with cracks 9.housekeeping "tidy up" our room when we came back, beds were moved and my shoes kicked underneath our beds. (my shoes were put tidily under the couch before we left our room) 10. we asked the receptionist to change another room, he told us immediately "NO". he didn't even check their system. i am working in hotel industry, i know very well about it. he just didn't want to change our room. it is just the matter of allocation one room to the others and he told us the room was reserved for someone else. Do you think this kind of excuses guest will happy to accept it?? he finally changed another room which was on the top floor, it was little better than the one we had but it was still dirty. window didn't close, rain drain on one corner of the bed. we were dissatisfied every time we walked into the room. we will not recommend anyone to stay with them. This was what we get and treated. i rather pay more to stay in a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: WorcestershireNomad
Reviews.Content: Well the one thing you will get out of staying at this hotel is toned legs...the stairs go on forever... The room is basic and compact with very little in them except a rickety cupbaord and a small wardrobe.. The view overlooked a load of run downbuildings to the rear. I'll be honest ,We paid next to nothing to stay in a prime position centrally in amsterdam So for what we paid it was fine. The breakfast in the morning was dire.My brother refused to eat anything as as soon as he walked in he saw a mouse scuttle along the kitchen floor..My first mouthful of the cup of tea i poured had something in it ,and upon inspection I found it to be a dead flea that I pulled out of my mouth! There are signs everywhere saying do not eat in the rooms.I guess this is to try and curb the mouse problem they have.. I'd stay here again purely for the location..But it isnt somewhere I would relish or look forward too..

Reviews.Title: “This is not an hotel, it's a rat's nest.”
Reviews.Author: roberto s
Reviews.Content: This is not an hotel, it's a rat's nest (literally, not metaphorically speaking). You can hear the rats walking inside the walls during night. I slept with a nest near my bed, precisely my head for almost 4 days and the last days i saw the mouse walking around the room. I asked the reception to change my room because i had to take the airplane the next morning and a weird man told me to sleep. I told him i would call the police and he menaced me saying: "do you think am i afraid of you? go to call the police!" then he changed humor and start to speak about stupid nonsense stuff like mice are nice pets and other boshes laughing in my face. After 1 hour he put a mouse trap in the room and told me to sleep. I had to take the airplane within few hours i couldn't do nothing else to do than try to sleep. The rooms are disgusting, the pictures on their sites aren't true, dirty walls old and scratched wood panels everywhere with a lot of weird holes(guess what they are),dust and old sockets behind the beds, mattress, sheets and and blankets are so dirty with ugly spots like they find them outside in the landfill. Continental breakfast for them means ham and cheese slices, bread and boiled eggs every day. Next time i will go to a charity public dormitory, will be better for sure and i will not have to pay so much. It s impossible for me to give them even one star but i can't publish this review if i don't do so. I watched other reviews and now I feel lucky to have not been bitten by fleas...

Reviews.Title: “ItÂ´s OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: juliopmaia
Reviews.Content: All right. First of all, Amsterdam is not the cheapest city in Europe. This is a well- located place, rigth next to the central station and the city attractions. The room is not so confortable, but itÂ´s enough for solo travellers.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've ever seen. Broken windows and walls, terribly dirty, smoke everywhere (too much for Amsterdam, too), disgusting "toilets", unstable and precipitous stairs. Room as holes. Absolutely cleanliness. Someone says it's the rats heaven: luckily we didn't see any, probably because we stayed most of the day out. Disagreeable receptionists . Pay attention: prices are 5% higher than what is written because of a "city tax" the hotel impose to you; if you pay with card it's 5% more.

Reviews.Title: “clean in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PaulaR57
Reviews.Content: The hotel was definitely well located! It was a very short walk from Central Station, as well as, both of our tours that we took during our stay. It did, have numerous flights of stairs and no lift. However, that was clearly stated in their description of their facility. It was in need of some cosmetic updating but it was very obvious that updating was being addressed. It was quite clean and the only negative experience was the breakfast buffet that was poorly set up in a restaurant next door...it was complete chaos and "feeding frenzy" would have more accurately described the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: HBFFtraveler
Reviews.Content: The shower water temperature was inconsistent and my daughter and I got scalded, the bathroom smelled so incredibly horrible (as if the sewer was backed up) and the hotel was just disgusting in general. We also ruined my son's jacket as they had just painted the room (another awful smell), but not notified us. It was still expensive, so there is nothing worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Diabolical”
Reviews.Author: chadd3
Reviews.Content: Apart from the relatively friendly staff on the reception desk, this hotel hasn't a single leg to stand on in terms of quality. Amenities are as bad as they get, toilets and showers are dirty and grimey, so much so that I avoided using either in this hotel as much as possible. Rooms were mouldy and the ceiling in our room had a massive leak. Beds were rock hard and tiny. Friend and I woke up covered with little bites and rashes, bed bugs perhaps? If so, even more reason to avoid this hotel. Be advised, as cheap as this place is, don't expect much, in fact don't expect anything at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great starting point for your citybreak to amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AndreVz
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is without any doubt the location. In one of the main avenues, between the centraalstation and dam square, it's an excelent starting point to go anywhere in amsterdam (including the airport, specially if you have a late night/early morning flight). Despite that, we stayed at a 3 beded bedroom, which actually was no frills at al. The bedrom was small, the beds not very confortable, the floor boards had no finishings, the wardrobe was falling apart, along with the radioator cover. The only thing you could see from the window was the next building, 2m away, and noise coming. The room had a small misplaced tv on top of a short legged table, making it impossible for the 3 guests to watch it at the same time while in bed. Breakfast was at the restaurant next door, and it was also very disappointing, 2-day left-over bread, butter, jam, hard boiled eggs, coffee and juice. So, to sum it up, i think this hotel has a great locations, the rooms are poor, but clean, making it a good place to go back to sleep in the end of the day, counting on that you wont be spending much of your days at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups of young people”
Reviews.Author: nnnx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Manofa in June 2011 for 4 nights with 4 of my friends. Our room was perfect for us. We had 3 bunk beds, leaving us with a spare mattress in the room.. our room was a large room, we had plenty of space for all our stuff, as well as all 5 of us being in the room at one time.. Having the wash basin in the room was extremely handy too! As we didn't have an en suite we had to use the communal shower, which wasn't too great, but it did the job... Tip.. Take flip flops or sandals that you can shower in.. I wouldn't advise anyone to walk bare foot in there!! We were on the fourth floor of the building, we had a great view from our room. Also, we were allowed to smoke in our room, which was really lucky, as all of 5 of us are smokers. The staff were really helpful when we checked in, and as we had no problems whatsoever, the next time we spoke to them was when we checked out! Location is brilliant, you've got everything you could possibly need on one street! Another tip, buy food from the dutch supermarket, Albert Heijn.. They've got great priced food and drink, you can fill your belly up for cheap!! :-P A lot of the reviews have made this hotel sound really bad, but if you're a group of young guys or girls and just want to enjoy Amsterdam for the city and not your hotel, this place is for you..!

Reviews.Title: “Spartan, just for fun with friend”
Reviews.Author: andreplastic
Reviews.Content: I went there with 4 friend, we took a 5 bed room. The room was stuffed with beds, probably a triple with 2 more bed in it. The Hotel is in a good position, on the Damrak, near the Train Station. At the entrance a tipical Dutch stair (very sheer!!) will welcome you, be carefull, because you can fall back if you don't pay attention. Talking about neatness our room was decent, the bathroom is very small. I don't suggest this Hotel for family or old couple, but for young people that doesn't care about lots of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful journey”
Reviews.Author: THE_POET_11
Reviews.Content: Honestly we were little worried since we read all the bad news about the hotel but kind of relief and surprinsgly the hotel was very good .regarding location it is a perfect spot for tourists being among all touristic areas,the staff is very very very friendly and the room was pretty clean and we did not had rats or anything that bothered us. for one star hotel i believe they did a great job there.I enjoyed my stay and sure thing recomended it to my friends back in cairo.

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel of my life”
Reviews.Author: marcodelbo
Reviews.Content: Got 5% extra charge because payed with credit card. This is not advertised anywhere. The person at the reception should be fired. He was very rude, smoking. His behaviour was unacceptable and that when you were complaining and making comments to other customers he shouted at you an asked me to leave. My room was very small, disgusting, very hot, super noisy. The towel was in pieces and I just had one. I arrived on Easter day, and I was charged 127 EU. The regular price is 50. Never go to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay at the Manofa Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMackaness
Reviews.Content: OMG. I was travelling with my elderly mother-in-law, who is an octogenarian and walks with the aid of a walking stick. This meant that we could not really stay in a hotel, which has a lot of stairs, and we definitely wanted one which was quiet and had a no smoking policy. Well, we went to drop off our bags at the reception as we had arrived in Amsterdam earlier than expected. The first thing to greet us was a steep stairway of approximately twenty steps and a very smoky reception. When we returned at the agreed time of 2pm the room was still not ready. But that was the least of our problems. When we were eventually allowed into the room, we discovered it backed onto the main reception area, which as I mentioned earlier was very smoky. So, during our stay we were accompanied by a constant cloud of smoke which appeared to creep from the reception, under our room door and into the contents of the room; the curtains; the bedding; our travelling clothes and of course up our nostrils. Rather unpleasant being non-smokers! We had a couple of nice paintings in the room, which were perched against the wall, rather than hung on the wall, but one picture looked like the scene from a horror movie so we just turned it round! The room lights were not working, so out of courtesy I took the three dead bulbs from the lights to reception, where upon they were replaced. However, my bedside light, which I would use to read, appeared to have an electric fault. The showerhead, instead of allowing the water to come out evenly, spurted out sporadically. To use the loo and the hand basin, although I was able to step over the water, my mother-in-law was forced to walk through a puddle of water. The water was obviously not draining. Throughout the entire night, right up until 8am the following morning, the air conditioning units that were directly outside our window blared out like hair dryers on full power. To top it all, we were deceived and taken advantage of. Elska, who was the female receptionist, told us that the showerhead would be replaced and that the 'technician' was just off to purchase a new one. Little did we realise that both she and the technician were both off duty 20 minutes later, as we were duly informed of by the new male receptionist Walid, who appeared to be very nice but smoked from behind the reception desk the entire time we were there. Walid did offer me no less than three other rooms the following morning, after I told him about our experience. Each of the three other rooms also had problems. Either the curtains did not close fully; the showerhead did not have a bracket (so you could not have a hands free shower) or BOTH! There was absolutely no way I was going to allow us to stay another night. So, I went straight to Lindenburg - the Excursions Booking office, where Pete (a very nice, kind and sympathetic, bespectacled man) helped us enormously. Pete booked us a twin en suite room at the Citadel hotel in Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 98-100 and we had a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rats and poor service, but a decent location”
Reviews.Author: Poonage
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3-bed room for 3 nights and the room had rats in it. They didn't bother us unless we had food left out overnight, so it's alright if you keep the place clean yourself. The location is great, its a few minutes walk from dam square and centraal station and the included breakfast is decent. Service is not amazing, but you get what you paid for. The WiFi didn't reach our room so you may not get it in yours. However, you can use the PC in the reception for up to 15 minutes free. We paid 50 euroes each for 3 nights, the shower was en-suite bathroom was surprisingly clean and well-kept and our room was cleaned and we go fresh towels each day. The room also had a TV in it, but ours didn't work so I'm not sure if yours will either. All in all, you get what you paid for. If the rats are a major concern then don't bother with this place. If you aren't likely to bring food to the room at all, it may be worth considering thanks due to the location

Reviews.Title: “Totally adequate, don't let the reviews scare you.”
Reviews.Author: gemma2330
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews i was anxious that the hotel was going to be disgusting. I traveled with my partner and found our en-suite room was fine, i suspect many of the cleanliness issues may be with the dormitory rooms. Our room was by reception so i was noisy but very convenient to crawl into at the end of the day. Our bedding and towels were clean each day (if a bit tatty) The hotel staff were great, very friendly and helpful. Yes the man on reception was constantly smoking but so what! We did have a mouse in the wall in our room, he seemed to be immune to the plug in mousey-scarey-device that i bought and took with us. It's only a mouse though. Breakfast was in the restaurant next door and did the job nicely. The location was perfect, right across the road form the red light district and 1 min walk to Dam square. To be honest we just wanted somewhere to put our heads down, it was old fashioned and tired looking but affordable and clean. Do still book with caution though.

Reviews.Title: “this is a hostel not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: spokEngland
Reviews.Content: i have to agree with all the reviews about this "hotel" the rooms were very dirty, infested with rats so could not sleep, poo smeared on the walls, unhelpfull staff who didnt seem to care about the state of the place, and all 4 of us come home with bites and rashes from the creatures living in the bedding. this was a seriouse let down to my partner and all concerned as it was his first holiday away from britain, and has put us off ever going to amsterdam again in the fear that all hotels in this area are the same

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE. COMPLETE AND UTTER CESSPIT.”
Reviews.Author: homeboy87
Reviews.Content: Rooms are completely not as advertised on their website. We booked a 5 bed dorm room, which was actually a tiny, dirty, bunkbed cesspit (not like it looks on their website). There was a tennis ball sized hole in the door where the keycard locking system should be. When mentioned to the owner, he stated this is normal, and this is what happens in amsterdam. Owner was rude and completely not bothered. The owner was also very dodgy, saying we could smoke, but then also their could be a $350 fine for smoking. Couldn't possibly trust him any less so we walked out. Total shabby mess of a place, not worth the money when you can pay an extra $5 and be somewhere half decent.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for over the weekend !”
Reviews.Author: Maria778
Reviews.Content: The best location you could get in Amsterdam on the main road, wonderfull & helpfull staff, good value for money, rooms are ok, fresh clean towels changed every day, free breakfast wasnt bad neither in a nice spacious restaurant where you get 15% discount for a dinner or lunch. Just wished there was an elevator, the steps are really steep and narrow.

Reviews.Title: “Our room smelt of POO”
Reviews.Author: mikeTNA
Reviews.Content: 11th - 14th Feb 2010 was my 5th trip to Amsterdam and my partnerâ€™s first trip. Every time I had been with friends before we had stayed with Hotel Manofa, I know for a fact we had all told other people to stay here as it was very good value for money. I did have that opinion up until my most recent visit! We checked in on the Friday at 10pm and were given room 303, as we opened the door first thing that hit us was the stench of poo, Iâ€™m not over exaggerating, the room smelt of poo! Which of course isnâ€™t really the best first impression of the city and our accommodation for the next few nights, especially for my partner it being her first trip! What could only have made it worse is that the window would not open further than a couple of inches! We decided to leave it until the morning until we would say something about our complaint. Saturday morning, I went down and told the reception staff, he assured me he himself would look at it, things seemed promising but he had said right out we would not be able to get a new room! Which I thought was quite unfair as it made you feel very unclean whilst in the room. Getting back Saturday afternoon, hoping our room would be okay, was the opposite, they had come in and cleaned the whole bathroom and sprayed a lot of air freshener but did not solve the problem at all! Continuing with our unhygienic stay, my partner came home with a lot bites and rashes which we believe was a result of something in the bedding! We didnâ€™t let it get us down too much, we had an awesome time because the city is amazing we just went for walks and so didnâ€™t spend much time in the room. Since getting back we have been looking at different hotels/ apartments for next time!! I have emailed a copy of this review to Hotel Manofa and will advise people not to stay there despite its perfect location on Damrak!

Reviews.Title: “Once room for two nights. Not amazing but a room with a bed sink and tv”
Reviews.Author: PAUL65464
Reviews.Content: for the price i was very happy. Its in a good location. Not for a romantic couple but a group of mates or by yourself its fine

Reviews.Title: “the worst ever in the world”
Reviews.Author: deejay8567
Reviews.Content: I have travelled everywhere and been in a lot of backpackers hostels but this was the dirtiest, worst value for money place I have ever stayed in. We paid over 200 euro for 4 of us in a quad room - if we had paid 50 euro between us we would have got value for money possibly. the room was dirty, the shower head didnt work, the toilet didnt flush properly, the small balcony was dirty, covered with cigarette butts and ash and the door outside door didnt close properly. When i complained about this and the room was not secure I was told not to be so silly as noone could possibly get onto the balcony from outside - this is reasonably true but not the point when you are paying so much - they refused to fix it. The curtains were so dirty and ripped and didnt close properly and there was no handle into the bathroom area. They did eventually say we could move rooms - however i was travelling with two elderly ladies - the staircase was steep and narrow and the carpet was ripped and they wanted us to move 2 floors up. This was the most unpleasant experience ever. Also the smell of marijuana drifted from other rooms which upset the older ones.

Reviews.Title: “DIRTY AND MICE IN THE ROOM !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tsaotsao4
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Totally unacceptable !!!!! whenever i close the lights mice were running in the room ! I finally caught one of them in a box. I had some leftover food and i put it inside a box that i had. The mouse was eating the food and i closed it inside the box. The reception staff was really angry and so stupid !!!!!! Anyway we were supposed to stay there for 5 nights but we left after the first. Never go to this hotel trust me !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I have photos and videos for this crap hotel and anyone who doesn't believe me i can prove what i am saying !!!!!! This hotel MUST BE SHUT DOWN NOW !!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but could improve a lot”
Reviews.Author: cindoz
Reviews.Content: When booking the hotel I thought it was a bargain - 3 night stay for 2 people with breakfast for Â£140!! Bargain! Of course when doing this there is always an element of doubt in your mind when arriving. Knowing Amsterdam and the location of the hotel I wasnt too worried about stairs - so when faced with a room on th 4th floor I wasnt too worried. Arriving in our room, I was a little shocked to see the outdated furniture and TV but was happy to see the bathroom was clean (even with a worrying crack in the sink). I expected the nights to be noisey (being on Damrak) but was pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was. 3 good nights of sleep! Breakfast was good. All you really needed to start the day - bread, cheese, ham, salami, juice, tea and coffee and cereal. The boiled eggs where a nice surprise and it was nice to see that the staff was attentive to the guests needs - nothing ran out to the point of people having to go without right to the end. This is a trait I have experienced in high class hotels so it was nice to see a 1 star getting it right! I would like to comment on a few issues that could be addressed for improvement: The first being the fact that despite a sign in the reception area stating "smoking is not permitted in this area" the staff seemed to enjoy their cigarettes at all hours of the day. I was grateful that the room was non-smoking though. Second, a little handy work on the rooms would do them the world of good - a dash of paint, some new curtains and maybe a new sink. Third - breakfast is good but might be an idea to move the buffet to somewhere not so closed off and dead ended! Or simply place the hot drinks somewhere that people can get to them without affecting the food on the buffet. Heating wouldnt go amiss either! Finally - the mice issue. I know (from living and working in the city) that there are a lot of mice and rodents in most hotels. However, it would only better the service if the mice were dealt with so that you dont have to hear them or see them at any hour of the day. I'm not too bothered by mice but my friend nearly died when she saw the small thing near her bag.

Reviews.Title: “God forbid I ever end up there”
Reviews.Author: Mooshy_choosky
Reviews.Content: We booked a doubleroom for 2 days. when we arrived, surprise... had no bathroom in the room... and it was 90 euros per night... we upgraded to a room with bathroom... that was 115 euros per night. Horrible room, old furniture, smelly, dirty sheets. I didn#t want to stay the second night (which was 190 euros, if you can believe it). The receptionist, an extremly rude woman, said that we have to pay for the second night also, does not matter if we stay or not Let#s say they were right...with the cancelation. But before check out they came to our room, knocked on the door and said we have to leave the room before 11 Next month i saw on my credit card that I had paid 190 euros for I room I was thrown out of... so, never ever again. Horrible hotel, snotty attitude, extremly high prices

Reviews.Title: “Not a single complaint!!!”
Reviews.Author: conejitka
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when I booked Hotel Manofa and read reviews here. What a pleasant surprise it was when we arrived to the hotel. The location is absolutely perfect, nice staff at reception - one girl & one guy, always smiling. We had an En Suite Room on the 2nd floor, it had old floor & furniture but come on, what would you honestly expect from a one * hotel?? Everything was clean, including bed sheets, towels and bathroom. We stayed there for 3 nights and we had our room cleaned and got clean towels every morning. We didn't mind the stairs because so many places in Amsterdam are like that. Cannot complain about breakfast either, great variety, cereal, ham, salame, cheese, hard boiled eggs, jam, apple & orange juice, tea and coffee, white and brown bread...i mean what else would you wish in the morning? I've stayed in better rated hotels and breakfasts were much worse. To sum this up, I would recommend to my friends to stay here, only to those with young spirit and who don't moan too much.

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in my bed!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hallows0111
Reviews.Content: OK so upon arriving at the hotel I found the gentleman (using the term loosely) on reception to be a sleazy pervert. The reception area was filthy, as we were too early to check into our room we asked to use the public toilets. I can only add I feel so sorry for anyone staying in the Hostel part of the hotel as the toilet was filthy and the size of a match box. I caught a glimpse at one of the shared showers on my way past and a large chunk was missing from the bottom of the door and it looked like someone had been in there in work boots. The rooms in the 'Hotel' part were no better. There was graffiti and stains all over the walls, the wardrobe had only one door, no coat hangers and no rail. All of the beds and bedding stank. The bathroom was filthy and the shower curtain had a layer of grease on it. We had a balcony with a lovely view, the only problem being that the door was unsecure. Next to one of my friend's beds was an open radiator cover full of boxes of rat poisen and there was a mouse in my bed one night. I would strongly advise nobody to visit this hotel. I would not return there if you paid me.

Reviews.Title: “well words could just not describe this”
Reviews.Author: samdaz1408
Reviews.Content: Well a one night stay in amsterdam, after a lovely over night crossing with p & o mini breaks..very very basic okay for a one night stay. as we only slept in the room and didnt even unpack however no where to put your stuff if you wanted to.However one plus point the bed i had was very comfortable. Only comment i could make is be very broad minded.

Reviews.Title: “one big dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: FLOSSYWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: please please please don,t book this hotel just read all the reviews and they are all true it is the worst place i have ever stay at and would not put my dog in here as soon as we got here we try to cancell but the very unhelpful staff would not give us a refund, but wish i just lost the money and booked in some other hotel. we could not wait to leave this hotel dirty dirty dirty dirty dirty.

Reviews.Title: “cancellation trouble”
Reviews.Author: lillysmummy6
Reviews.Content: i haven't actually stayed in this hotel but im writing this review to warn others. I booked the hotel after reading the website and as there where no reviews on it at the time i trusted the information on the website, a few weeks later i come across this website full of dreadful reviews of the hotel so i booked another hotel. when trying to cancel my reservation at the manofa hotel i could not send an email as the address was wrong and when trying to phone it say i had dialled an incorrect number am i now stuggling to find a way of cancelling the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stag dos and not much else”
Reviews.Author: gould321
Reviews.Content: we went as a group of 6, They couldnt give us the 6 man room we booked for some reason so we ended up on the very top floor in a 9 man room. they did knock 20 euros off the bill and scraped the city tax bill tho. room was nine beds and a sink. stairs are a killer but every hotel in amsterdam is the same i guess with the stairs. We literally stayed there for 4 hours sleep. no frills and ok for 20-30 euros pp s*&t hole though

Reviews.Title: “dont even think about it....”
Reviews.Author: Pinhas24
Reviews.Content: It was simply horrible, there was graffiti on the walls of the bedroom, the toilets had a window where people from other rooms could see you, the shower was a joke, and there was blood on some doors! wouldnt sleep there ever again even if someone payed me for it!!

Reviews.Title: “don't!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 13j
Reviews.Content: terrible,horrible hotel i ever seen..i saw a muse in my room(101),i couldn't sleep..

Reviews.Title: “Um....well......”
Reviews.Author: zanluk
Reviews.Content: First off I stayed in the hostel part and the actual hotel rooms may have more to offer, but I don't think I would easily return to find out when in Amdam again. Good points: Check in was fine, everyone spoke English, great since although I can communicate in Dutch, I'm not fluent, so that was not a problem. There are two computers with free internet access limited to 1 hour, great because that way everyone could use it. It is central and 5 minutes from the train station and bang on location wise for coffee shops and the red light district. While the hostel aspect of it has no safe, there are post-box sized lockers big enough to lock the important bits away Deposit was 10 euros for the mini-safe. Rooms were cleaned properly daily. Breakfast was included and reasonable. Bad points: Room 30. No windows, no ventilation. toilets and showers two floors up. Had to change rooms every night but as I'm new to hostels will accept as normal and I was allowed to put my bag into whichever room I ended up in. A huge chunk of the ceiling in reception was missing and a bit of damp in all the rooms I slept in, although room 30 was the worst. I lived in Holland and have been to Amdam many times and struggled to find it because the entrance is hidden between a souvenier shop and an Argentenian steakhouse (which also served as the breakfast venue) I was not expecting a great deal for what I paid and I suppose I got treated politely because I could speak Dutch. I did kinda raise an eyebrow at the disdain two younger backpackers from Russia were treated with because of very basic English on their part.. I did kind of wonder about one of the cleaners smoking a joint, but hey, it's Amsterdam, its what I went there for......just like some of you.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent,linen was clean;staff had a sense of humour!”
Reviews.Author: ginjohn
Reviews.Content: Central to city sights ,breakfast was adequate;but the packed Breakfast did not materialise on the Monday morning as promised !Valueit you don't mind basic but it is only basic you are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “an absolute disgrace”
Reviews.Author: sheshe1962
Reviews.Content: save yourself a very big shock. dirty . smelly . mice. shower and toilet mingin.. no remote so no telly.. was asked to pay before i seen room. man on desk very abrupt to another guest when we were booking in that made us scared to ask for anything it spoiled my whole holiday.i hated every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Madness”
Reviews.Author: Jim1210
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the above Hotel last week, for my stagg doo in Amsterdam... For the money what more do you expect. the pics on easytobook.com are a bit mis-leading as it doesnt show the basic rooms, but its better then a hostal but at not much more money. We arrived and the guy behind the counter asked us to leave our bags near his desk, but he was quite busy so we asked if he would keep an eye on them, to which he smiled and said "i will try" which filled us with loads of confidence, as we has a laptop etc in them.. any way it was fine and we checked in and got our room cards and breakfast cards. Got to our room and it was like a cell, just four walls, badly in need of a lick of paint, the cealing had mould on it, the pillows was 2 tubes in a case and 6 beds.. no sink, toilet, shower or tv. But as i said on a stagg doo its not like we was staying in the room much, but the locks on the door was basic and the single glased window overlooking an alley way was a bit of a concern, but we went with it and all was fine. The hotel is for party people really, or young people. would not take family and stay here. The location was good too. I have stayed in Amsterdam lots of times before and usualy stay in Leidesplein, which is 10-15 mins away on foot from central station, and always enjoyed it, but as there was a few of us we needed to be central and noise not to be a problem, this was good. 24 hour reception and 2 mins on foot from central station. We did loose the best man for 19 hours tho so becarfull if its your first time, stick with whoever you go with as its very busy in the shopping areas and easy to loose each other in the crouds. The begging situation seems to be controled alot more too, as we didnt really get asked once, this might be because there was a group of roudy men drunk, but didnt really see many like the other times i have gone with my girlfriend. All in all we had a good time , until we lost someone, and would go back in a group. Not with the two of us tho, and not with anyone looking for a relaxing time. Our friends rooms were better, for some reason they got a shower and tv etc... might be because they had a smaller room?? Amsterdam its self seems to be alot more expensive, just in genral, the last time i went was last feb. We was paying 8 euro's for a jack daniels and coke. We did the organised pub crawl tho and that was a good way to see the nightlife , and get drunk cheaper. We did the Leidesplain one and it was a good laugh.

Reviews.Title: “These reviewers just have sand in their flaps, place was jammin'”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowShaun
Reviews.Content: n n n Me and 3 friends went there for a long weekend just for a bit of partying. We weren't expecting anything great for the price but when we got there we weren't dissapointed. We arrived too early to check in but the staff were friendly and helpful letting us leave the bags while we got a chance to see the city. When we got our room it was pretty standard but suited us fine, we just wanted somewhere to keep our stuff and crash out when we had partied 2 much. There was no complaints with noise and you were free to smoke in the room which was handy because you couldn't get alchohol in most cafes. There was loads of people staying there, all friendly enough to talk to, we ended up in some random people from Belfast's room gettin a smoke at 4 in the morning lol. It wasn't the cleanest place I've ever stayed and by far not the dirtiest but when your young and going to Amsterdam I don't think that should be high on the list of priorities. The staff were really helpful, we lost at least 5 keycards and they didint make 2 much fuss bout replacing them. The girl on the desk was helpful with information on getting around and things to do. I wouldn't recommend this for families or anyone who can't go a few days without home comforts but we all found it great and the location was perfect, right on the Damraak : ). If you're young and there for the party this place will definently suit. We thought it was so good we stayed there again in summer for Defqon.

Reviews.Title: “Now come on... It's not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: CDB03
Reviews.Content: I went here for four days In Feb 2010 for a smoking session with 4 friends. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor (after I'd booked the hotel through Easyjet) I was really worried but thankfully, there was no need to be! When we got to the hotel we were given our room keys and were offered a safety deposit box (for 10 euro deposit) which we took. We were also given passes for a free breakfast served every morning from 8-10am but we never made it down on time! We did however get a discount in the restaurant downstairs because we stayed in Manofa. We got upstairs (rooms 307 and 211) and were quite happy at what we saw. The room looked quite clean, even though it was very outdated but this didn't bother us because we were expecting a one star hotel. The stairs up to the room looked at bit mad and dangerous but they didn't cause us any problems. We had a tv with a few good channels like Paramount Comedy, MTV and TMF which came in handy. We also had a phone. The bathroom was really clean and the shower was dead on. We made a good bit of noise and the hotel management said nothing so that was good. We were also able to smoke in the rooms - suprisingly enough the smoke alarms didn't go off when we did?? lol The hotel is in a GREAT location - right beside loads of shops, restaurants and coffee shops and about 5mins from the red light district. It's also right beside the central station and a train to the airport is only 4.30 euros - a taxi is about 40 euros so a train is definitely the better idea! I think I would come back to this hotel as long as I knew that the rooms would be as good as before. At the end of the day, for the money you pay its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Do not go near this place !!!!”
Reviews.Author: uKAldo
Reviews.Content: We booked in a hurry then stupidly read the reviews..OMG!..managed to cancel thank god, however on arrival in Amsterdam en route to our idyllic accomodation, we walked past this place to see several police officers attending the place, filthy windows, curtains hanging off and all sorts of strange characters looking out the windows and going in and out! The entrance and stairs looked manky and i cannot believe how lucky we were to only lose Â£20, as i would NEVER have spent one hour in there never mind 4 nights. This place gives the appearance of a run down hostel with junkies loitering about and is not a "Hotel". Heed the reviews people and steer clear!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HELL EXISTS HERE”
Reviews.Author: thatpeskylimey
Reviews.Content: NEVER EVER stay here. A total HELLHOLE. There were brown stains on the wall. The shower smelt like death, perming solution and drains. The window was broken and wouldn't open. The bedsheets were dirty and the room stunk of stale weed and dead things. For a twin room, it was more like a cupboard. It doesn't deserve the one star it was given. Quite why it got one star, I will never know. I went to bed in my clothes as I would have caught some nasty disease from being naked anywhere near the bed or bedsheets. If a horror movie was real, they'd stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel imaginable! Makes every trip a bad one. (And its hard to have a bad trip in Amsterdam)”
Reviews.Author: alaala_9
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel Ive ever been to in my whole life. I chose here because 1. the good price 2. the good location 3. The website and the pictures made the rooms look ok. I dont know if Europeans have very very low standards compared to Americans, but this "2 star" hotel should not even have been open for business, it was so disgusting and repulsing. The radiator in my room was broken so the rats and the mice would run around my room freely, when I was trying to sleep, they would be scurrying around my head, and when I went to compain about it and change rooms, they said none were available, and that I would have to deal with it that night. After 3-4 nights of already trying to "deal with it" there was no way I was going to have a panic attack that mice were attacking both me and my belongings when I sleep. The bed was about an inch off the ground so I might as well be sleeping on the floor, with mice, and many of them. They were noisy and hungry. And when I finally got someone to come look at my room, they had one solution: A RAT TRAP! Like a single rat trap is going to fix a mice infestation. After smoking all day and all night, I want to come back to a hotel I feel secure and safe in. I left at 4-5am that night with all my belongings, traveling alone in the middle of the night in Amsterdam, to find a vacancy at another hotel. I went right down the street to the Hotel Victoria, which was a MUCH MUCH better choice- and about the same price as the Manofa on the weekends- and had a much better stay in Amsterdam. I cant say Im not scarred by my time at the Manofa in Amsterdam. If you want a real crap hole, go here. And a sprial staircase in a million year old building that is infested with mice and your room happens to be on the 5th floor of the building and theres no bellman to help you with your stuff after taking a 12 hour flight and having to leave after you realize the place you reserved a month ago was the biggest bukkah hole in the whole city. After days of complaining, I was unable to even reach a manager (GM) of the hotel, and I was not able to get my money back. I even had to pay for the night I had to leave at 4am to go searching on my own for another hotel with my packed luggage, travelling all alone, because I felt unsafe in the Manofa. DONT EVER GO HERE. EVER. And i also have a permanent scar from the hotel clerk applying alcohol and some other ointment and rubbing it in my deep cut on my leg when shaving in their [--] showers. a PERMANENT 3 inch scar on my leg from an untrained, un-medic, hotel clerk idiot INSISTING that he touch me. As in, grabbing my leg and not letting me go. If I knew anything about European law, I would sue the [--] out of this place. But no- I still have the 1000 dollar credit card bill from my stay, that Im trying to pay off. Thanks, Manofa. Go screw yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Its great for a 1 star hotel, terrible if you expect it to be like a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: tisquall
Reviews.Content: For 3 lads on a smoke up it was perfect, our room was nicely sized, clean, nice big window and decent, clean toilet/shower. Great location too, 3 minutes from train station and minutes from everything else (including mcdonalds) :D Bed sheets were clean and beds were comfy. For the money you pay its great, way better then i had expected reading other reviews. If you wanna stay in a nicer hotel then dont be so cheap people! Ya can't have everything. I'll be stayin there again when I go back. Negatives: Weren't allowed check in until 2pm which didnt matter too much since we were allowed leave our bags at reception. There was a mouse in the room on two occasions, but didnt bother us, it was tiny and once we came into the room it just ran back into the wall where it stayed. Besides it was prob our fault cuz we left so much food lying around on the floor etc. A few stains on the walls, which again didnt bother us, Its a 1 star hotel! Stop moaning, seriously If you dont mind the possibility of an odd mouse in the room then i'd defo recommend this hotel :P

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE do yourself a favour and DO NOT stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: calkuta
Reviews.Content: where to begin with the hotel Manofa! My girlfriend and I were planning a last minute trip to Amsterdam and found the Manofa on a hotel booking site...the pictures of the rooms looked realy nice and the price seemed reasonable...Yet when we got to our room it looked quite a bit different from the modern looking clean rooms advertised in the pictures!! It was not too bad at first, until you realize that the beds are uncomfortable, the rooms are dirty, there was other peoples hair on the pillows, the bathroom was pretty grimey and didnt even have a mirror. When my girlfriend enquired about the lack of a mirror to the desk guy he didnt really seem to care at all and said he would "see what he could do" i knew right then she wasnt getting a mirror!! not a big deal for me but she was a littlte peeved cus she couldnt get ready to go out. But all this was nothing compared to the second night!! There are signs all over the hotel saying "no food in the rooms" this is because the hotel is infested with mice and they will come into our rooms to get the food!! I was just falling into a blueberry haze dreamland when my girlfriend grabbed me by the arm and screamed "theres something in the room!!" sure enough there was a little mouse crawling across the bed, and it had been in my girls purse where she had forgotten she had some potato chips in there...we called the front desk to tell them there was a mouse in the room and they were pretty much nonchalant about the whole thing, all he said was "oh..."so we switched rooms to a different room at 3 in the morning, and when we got to the new room surprise, no sheets on the bed and it smells like someone just smoked a massive bob marley spliff in there...i went back up to my old room, and took the sheets and pillows and I had to set up the new room by myself!! Really good service for 105 euros a night huh!? I finally was just about to fall asleep when again there is a mouse in this room too!! there was also some kind of cabinet built into the wall that had a hole in the top of it and when you looked in all you could see was garbage and used condoms!! sweet!! needless to say i wasnt sleeping another night in this dump. I went to find a new place at 5 in the morning walking around by myself and found a much nice place for a much more affordable price! Then when i went to ask for a refund at Manofa (we had booked 3 nights in advance but stayed one night and then didnt get much sleep the next night with the mice and all that) the guy at the desk said he would have to wait for his boss...anyway we ended up getting back the money for the last night that we didnt stay on but i feel we should have been compensated for the second night with the rodents and room changing and all that....anyways i would not recommend this dump to my worst enemy!! You would be way better off staying in a hostel for much cheaper if you are going the affordable route, but there are many nicer and much cheaper hotels right downtown (check raadenstraacht) that are cheaper and a hell of a lot cleaner with much better service!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gimesun
Reviews.Content: We made a booking for a twin room for two nights. When we arrived we were told we couldn't have this room and we could only have two beds in a shared room with 3 strangers AND for the same money! The manager refused to discuss a discount and gave us a take it or leave it offer. As it was the night of the Holland V England football match we did not have any choice but to stay there as we suspected all other hotels would be fully booked. So we ended up paying 150 Euro to stay with strangers in a filthy room with no bathroom or security. I can not advise you strongly enough to NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JRBBantam
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be better situated for whatever....but beware it most definately not a romantic place for two. We were on a stag do so rarely used the rooms. However compared to the hotel's website - the rooms were misleadingly bad!! In one triple room one bed was two mattresses on the floor!! And there were wires hanging out of the walls. For the price we paid - Â£135 per room per night - we expected something a little better!! Also beware of the 3% card charge to pay for your room!! However we still had a brilliant weekend, even if the hotel was Very, Very BAD!!!

Reviews.Title: “it need's to be closed down!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandSush
Reviews.Content: me and my partner have been in amsterdam last week on holiday. we have come all the way from ireland, we booked the manofa hotel on the internet it looked great on the pic's, but when we arived it was a diff story it was disgustng, no outher word could decribe it, when we got to the door i new at that point it was a low run down disgusting place, the dirt was caked on to the stairs we arived at half 11 and we had to wait around till half 1 just to see the room. when we opend the door of the room i near cryed it was awful there was a horible smell and the floor was coverd in dust, the bathroom had white tile's that had turnd gray with the dirt and they where all broke it is a health hazzard. we got are suitcases and left not in a millon years would i have stayed there, you could not even see out the window's with the dirt and the reception desk was falling to pieces. it need's to be closed down and very quick i would never in a millon years reconmend this shak of a place to anyone i would not even call it a hotel. we then got a room in the van gelder hotel and it was luzary compared to the manofa. the van gelder hotel was old and had antiqe furniture but it was very clean and i felt really safe there.

Reviews.Title: “sharing my bed with mice!”
Reviews.Author: IrelandBrophy
Reviews.Content: i am not a fussy person and am ok with cheap and cheerful but this was neither! i have travelled a lot and have never stayed in a dump such as this, i was lying in bed one night and felt something under the sheet, i pulled it back and there was a mouse in the bed, when i complained the guy on reception was neither shocked or concerned and we were given another room, it was our last night so it was not worth moving to a different hotel, however when we moved to the other room we were awoken by two guests entering our room so back to reception to complain and lo and behold new guy on reception had not been told we were moved to another room so activated a card for the new guests, also the alarm call message had not been passed on. this rodent infested dump charged us 95 euro per night for this torture but hopefully by writing this review they will have fewer guests to put through this and this place is closed. Oh i forgot to mention that the fire sprinkler was covered in a plastic bag. they also had signs warning patrons not to bring food to the rooms and i found out why! dont go there its awful!

Reviews.Title: “No frills value for money”
Reviews.Author: brucie69
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasin a prime location only 2 minuets from central station and only 2 minuets from most of amsterdams attractions. I read many reviews on this hotel before i booked it and was a bit sceptical at first but booked it anyway. The price was very reasanoble and was in prime location for 6 lads wanting to party. The rooms were generally clean and adequate for what we wanted, Just somewhere to sleep,wash and change. Would certaily use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL - IT IS DIGUSTING AND NOT FIT FOR RATS!”
Reviews.Author: emma201282
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have just got back from our trip to Amsterdam which was amazing. This however can't be said of the hotel - in one word it was digusting. We booked a room for 5 people; the walls were covered in dirt and stains of god-knows what, the mattresses had blood stains on, the wardrobe covered in graffitti, the door hanging off the hinges, the bathroom revolting and the main light socket smashed with the wires hanging out - so all in all a complete Health & Safety disaster and something that the hotel inspectors in the UK would love to close down! Seriously it looked like a squat and with all the stains over the walls it really did resemble a junkie's hideout! When we arrived a couple were complaining about the cleanliness and were demanding their money back as well - with no luck. They warned us not to stay here however we had booked through Easy to Book (they are useless, don't trust them) and the hotel had our credit card details. To cut a very long story short, Easy to Book washed their hands of the situation and said 'what do you expect for a 1 star hotel in Amsterdam' my reply 'something clean and not riddled with bacteria and germs that even rats wouldnt want to occupy'. The hotel refused to refund all our money and we had to pay for 1 night's stay which was about 250 euros - but there was no way we were sleeping there. Luckily the Tulip Inn Hotel around the corner took pity on us having been made accustomed to the vast number of tourists refusing to stay at Hotel Manofa. The staff at Hotel Manofa were incredibly rude and were laughing at us referring that we were stupid because we shouldnt have believed the images on the internet using the metaphore 'when you see a picture of a Big Mac you don't really expect it to look like that do you?' !!!!!! We are sure that this hotel makes it's money from unhappy tourists turning up seeing their dirty, shabby rooms and then making the wise decision to stay elsewhere only to be told they will be charged for the first night without any get out clause! Please don't ever consider staying here - I now plan to write to 'Nederkandse Hotel Classificatie' to have this revolting place shut down!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty,Bug infested fire trap.Dont go there.”
Reviews.Author: nobby329
Reviews.Content: If you get 1 of the rooms shown in the pictures that advertise the hotel you are very lucky.We got two rooms with 6 mattresses on the floor in what can only be described as a filthy bug infested fire trap.Stained bed linen,dead insects splattered on the wall, sticky carpet.The nearest bathroom was 2 floors away(and it was obvious some people never made it that far)We turned up in amsterdam on a bank holiday weekend with no accomodation so its not surprising that the only hotel to have enough space for 12 was the worst. After 3 nights of staying here every one in our group had insect bites and rashes.Never again will we turn up on spec.It is beyond belief how this place has never been closed down.Dont chance it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: corrigan_eileen
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 person room for a hen weekend in Amsterdam. We weren't expecting a 5 star but the place is a dump! The stairs are even very dangerous by Amsterdam standards, at some points only having about 3 inches to balance your foot on while dragging you bags up (no staff to help). We checked in, finally made it to our room,having to climb over bags of rubbish and dirty linen thrown in the corridors. The cleaner saw us stuggling and didn't offer to move the vacume cleaner (just glared at us for taking so long in passing). The photos on the net are clearly photoshopped. We were given a 2 person room with 2 extra beds squeezed in. 2 single beds pushed together, you had to climb over these and another bed. The 4th bed was blocking access to the bathroom. All four of us couldn't fit in the room together, let alone with our bags. We immediately demanded our money back, stating that the hotel was clearly not what was advertised and even offered to show the manager the website to prove our point (there are computers in the lobby). They have obviously had this complaint before because they gave us a full refund. We ended up staying at the Bull Dog behind Dam Square and had an amazing stay!!! Please do not book this "hotel", it does not look like the online pictures and we did not feel safe even for the 30 minutes that we were there for!

Reviews.Title: “Marginally better than sleeping in a doorway.”
Reviews.Author: Redster1970
Reviews.Content: Okay, I know the score with the hotels on Damrak - you don't get much in the way of facilities, but you don't pay much either. I've been staying in Amsterdam on business for over 15 years in these places and that's fine - as long as there's a bed and it's clean I'm happy. The Manofa, on the other hand delves new levels of awfulness. The room was dirty, dingy and sorely in need of redecoration, the furniture worn out and broken. The window wouldn't open and it was stifling in the room - you couldn't turn the radiator off. There wasn't even a cup provided, but in the cupboard under the desk was a half eaten bag of crisps and an empty Martini bottle. The worst of all were the pillows - they were literally a block of foam rubber covered in a filthy old sack masquerading as a pillow case. Although they proclaimed proudly they were a "no smoking" hotel, the place reeked constantly of marijuana. Come on - cheap is fine, I don't expect the Ritz. What I do expect is cleanliness and a lick of paint. This really is the pits, and at this end of the market there's a lot of competition - I should have paid an extra â‚¬2.50 and got a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Rats strolling down the room”
Reviews.Author: AdriShl
Reviews.Content: This was definetly the worst experience I ever had with a hostel. I have booked the hostel online and when we arrived there we payed for 4 nights. We went in the room to sleep after an exhausting trip. The room seemed ok, not very fancy, but just ok. Just before falling asleep, I saw some strange shadows above the entrance door. First I thought that maybe someone was passing by on the corridor. In 5 minutes, same shadows. It became rather strange so we opened the door. There was nothing. Finally, we turned off the light and we made a little bit of light using my cell phone. What we saw was so disgusting, from 5 to 5 minutes there were rats passing under the door, going straight to the bathroom door and going out through some pipes. Of course we took pics of the rats and we went at the receptionist saying there were rats in our room. At first he told us that it couldn't be, after we showed him the pics he said that all the hotels in Amsterdam might have rats because Amsterdam is situated on a network of canals ?!?! Finally we asked our money back, but we got a firm NO from the receptionist, his only option being another room, next to the reception. No rats in that room, it is true. I guess it is a matter of luck or of rat mood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs modernisation.”
Reviews.Author: Graftarian
Reviews.Content: Location is great - half way between Central Station and Dam Square. There's free internet Access. Rooms are basic and in need of modernisation, but our room was generally clean. Bathroom wasn't particularly hygenic. We went in november and the room was cold at that time of year. Breakfast time wasn't great so best avoided. Also because it's so close to the red light district and its numerous coffee shops, you shouldn't expect a good nights sleep. Expect plenty of fellow travellers making plenty of noise throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “It'll do for budget travellers but be prepared”
Reviews.Author: pukupie
Reviews.Content: There are a couple of good things to say about this hotel... the best being that there is no curfew and the reception is 24hrs. So no need to worry about getting locked out. The people on the reception were always pretty helpful. It's also close to the station. However, when we entered our room there were holes in the ceiling and although the man who cleans the rooms had just left, it felt and looked so unclean, years worth of ingrained dirt that you probably couldnt even get off with Cillit Bang. Cobwebs and spiders all over the ceiling. There was no toilet roll or towels in the bathroom. Then half an hour after check in while I was in the middle of getting changed, there was a knock on the door and without waiting enough time for anyone to get to the door to open it, a man lets himself into the room with the toilet roll and towels! The towels I could not bring myself to use and went out to buy some. The pillows were not only half the normal size of a pillow but so thin it was hardly worth bothering with and the 'duvet' was about as useful as the pillows. The room was advertised as having a tv ...it did but the tv screen was tiny and the 3 channels it had were so fuzzy that you just couldnt watch it, no matter how much we tried to tune them in better. All in all, if you really dont care and are just looking for a place to crash when you get back from a good night out, then its fine, but in that case you are probably better off getting a private room in a hostel, it'd be cheaper and probably cleaner. If you are looking for something halfway decent dont stay at the Manofa.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: JorgePrague
Reviews.Content: the hotel is not that bad i was staying there with my 5 friends and they gave us a 5-bed-room with private bathroom, the room was not lovely, but absolutely good for sleeping after parties in Amsterdam the best thing is its location - is in the very centry of Amsterdam, so everything is near... we appreciated it when we were returning from clubs (which are absolutely amazing there...) so dont be affraid of mice :))

Reviews.Title: “If you like mice, fire hazards, dirt, grime and soiled matresses then book this!”
Reviews.Author: NewtonIsGay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a stag dooooo but it turns out that most of Europe has also stayed there on a stag doooo and the hotel has not bothered to update / fix up the rooms in the last 30 years or so. A friend in my room was awoken in the middle of the night by MICE eating his crisps! In short if you want to stay in the middle of Amsterdam and dont mind dirt, mice, bad rooms (some dont even have windows!!!! honestly, no windows) and fire hazards then stay here. If you value your life / cleanliness then stay somewhere else. The only thing that made staying in the hotel okay was the company! Wobbly Bob and Pete Drug Sponge were a constant distraction from the state of the place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: cemelda
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed et the Manofa Hotel in Amsterdam. We found the hotel easily although we don't know the city. It is just walking distance to the main station. And the main street of the Manofa Hotel is very crowded and live. Amstrdam is wonderful, you can walk al the city or better, rent a bike. The places are very close to each other and flat so it is easy to ride bikes. Manofa is a little hotel like the others. Rooms are relly small. This is the typical problem. All the buildings are seriously small, you can wash your hands one by by. The room dosen't exist a bathroom. But thankfully my boyfriend requested the hotel for a room closer to the bath room and they gave us the closest room. Thanks for that. Rooms are really small, beds are not so clean, but really very big. When you enter the room, the bed is all of the room. You can barely move in the room with the luggages. The only bed thing was the breakfast. It was prepared at some diner place under the hotel. There wasn't much thing to eat, we thought that staying in a only bed hotel was a better idea than bb. Besides there are lots of nice places for coffe, waffles and some other kind of eateries on the main street of Manofa. Damrak is the most central place in Amsterdam. So location of hotel was great. Reception was very helpful about the directions, places and other infomation. It was a nice, cheap, centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: bobbyosullivan
Reviews.Content: I freaked out after i booked 8 nights in the hotel then stumbled across this website- but all was well, it's just 3 mins away from the central station so no dragging your stuff across town, staff will mind your bags if you arrive too early, we were put on the top floor-yes there steep but your in amsterdam don't be so lazy, the walls could do with a fresh coat but who cares your there to see the city, none of us ever made it to breakfast so can't comment on that, you can smoke in the room,we told the cleaners that we didn't need any cleaning for the week from fear of having our sfuff robbed due to the reviews but they still left clean towels every day(and took nothing!), a toilet for men/women and then another toilet opposite this for women only- which i did not understand! staff were helpful when the door wouldn't read the keycard once or twice. Four of us stayed in a 4-bed-room which was about e27 each a night cheapest you'll find anywhere in Amsterdam other than sharing a room with 20 strangers in a hostle that is. No rats no mice but then again we left no food on the floor(and no bedbugs!). Another friend came with us and got an ensuite room to themselves which was nearly e60 a night which wasn't really worth it(you can get single rooms in a 2star for 50). But if your travelling in groups this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Omg worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaByrne_
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel ever!! We arrived Monday to a dump of a hotel..And we got a load of grief off the staff to pay for the room even tho it had been charged on credit card already!! My friends arrived 4+ hrs earlier and had to walk around Amsterdam Central lugage with dem untill 12.30 because the could not check in until then..Friends also paid extra for a room with shower/toilet and only got the room for 1 nigh and got moved to the basement for the second nigh.. The rooms are so old like the paint or wat ever yad call it is suposed to b white i think n its like cream n yellow..The lane down the side of the hotel had like [---]on d window n i mean proper [----]!!! The wardrobes are like somethin from the 1800s!! Jus dont go to this hotel..Its far from the 2 star it was rated!! Not worth a free night in it!! The location was the best thing about eh!! Shocking Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JayjayCM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. There were 3 lads in total and we stayed in the triple room here. We arrived to find a very basic style room with old furniture and wallpaper. After a couple hours of settling in we actually grew to like this room. There were 3 large windows that opened up and overlooked the main Damrak street. This was a great view and had a window ledge below all the windows which was useful for putting stuff on or sitting on whilst you stared out onto the street. We could not have asked for a better location. Central station was literally at the top of the road (5 minute walk). The famous Grasshoppers coffee shop and restaurant was literally across the road and the red light district was about 3 streets away. I would recommend that you try out a bar named â€œTEASERSâ€�. This is about 3 hotels down from the Manofa. We spent all night in there. Theres fit waitresses that serve you drinks all night and there sound girls. We spent all night chatting to them and eventually dancing with them. We are planning to come back here and most likely will request this room again as its ideal. The shower was always working and powerful. The bathroom was not dirty it was crystal clean and I do believe looked like a new toilet and basin. Personally I would recommend this hotel for groups of lads as the location is ideal. I would not recommend this hotel for people who are picky about where they stay. If you are picky we spotted a nice looking hotel named the Tulip Inn not too far from here. Looked rather posh.

Reviews.Title: “it has to be said this place is a dive”
Reviews.Author: jackherer33
Reviews.Content: this place is an absolute dump. decievingly clean lobby, staircases that lead to, well nowhere! didnt try the food cant complain about the location i would stay again if nowhere else was availabl any old port in a storm as they say

Reviews.Title: “what a view, nextdoors windows”
Reviews.Author: beardlarden
Reviews.Content: a 4 bed economy room,thats it apart from the 7ft by 3ft wardrobe, and 1 chair, no tv, kettle, glasses, and one strange thing you cant close the curtain as it was 3ft shorter than the window, but this did not matter as we were on the first floor and we overlooked a 5 foot wide alley way. knew when i booked that the toilet and bathroom were on the same landing, but what they did not mention, was that you have to go up 13 stairs to get to THE same landing ? Good points, the location, the staff, a good shower, and best for me and me mates is smoker friendly. bad points, not too clean, cold hotel, small and very basic, to get to front desk first you must climb everest (about 42 steep steps) . I would only recommend this hotel to stag/hen nighters. me and the friends i was with agree that its our first and only stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great on a budget if you like wildlife and adventure!”
Reviews.Author: oddjobly
