Reviews.Content: Well we were on a stag weekend so i wasnt expecting much! but it fell short even of them! the stairs were steep getting steeper and smaller as you went up the floors, it started with nice carpet then threadbare and then lino to no carpet , bare boards and then holes in the floor big enough to get your foot through!! The rooms were compact , god knows what the stains in the bedding were! but the linen was sort of clean! Bathrooms luckily ours were en suite, drains stunk all the time making for an unpleasant time when we were sober! The mice were active so dont have food in your room, breakfast downstairs made us laughin the open kitchen area where the chef was juggling between his mobile phone and having a cigarette dropping his ash on the food and making the nice fresh bread on the shop counter without any form of hygene!! We decided against the breakfast! The one plus point the Manofa had going for it was that the location was fantastic for everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: ThisNameIsTakenAh
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I was dubious about going to the hotel last month. The hotel is very, very, very cheap. I paid Â£65 to stay there for 4 nights, which works out as Â£16 a night. For this I thought it was going to be awful, but, our room was clean, the shower was hot and the bathroom was in a good condition. The main problem with our room was that it was a bit dingy- this was because the window faced onto another hotel which you could practically step across too, and there were some strange marks on the wallpaper by the door! The staff were friendly, and we arrived early and flew out very late- they let us keep our bags in reception. Our room was even ready before check in. I will be honest, we heard rumours of mice- but I never saw/heard any! The location is excellent, if your on a tight budget i would give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute DUMP!!”
Reviews.Author: mollieblue
Reviews.Content: OK, so I'm just back from spending 4 days /3 nights in the worst hotel I've ever stayed in!! I have to agree with others on this site. The rooms don't resemble the pictures at all, the rooms where grubby, dingy and depressing and it's the only time I've been worried about the cleanliness of the bed linen! I can totally see why they want you to pay upfront - they want your money before you see the dump that this place is!!! I agree again that the breakfast from the restaurant next door was pitiful, stale bread and cereal!! I've taken photos to prove the mess!! we asked to change rooms which helped a bit. But then the water stopped working and we had none!! - hot or cold - couldn't even flush the loo!! we were also told that we were not allowed food in our room - we asked why and were told by the desk staff that it may attract rodents!!! one of my friends was wakened from his sleep by a scratchy noise from behind his bed!! All in all, a horrendous experience - in our opinion the place should be shut down!! worse than a very poor youth hostel - take it's star away and close it!! Ann Cochrane(disgusted!)

Reviews.Title: “Central but depressing...”
Reviews.Author: tkrysiak
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my recent trip to Amsterdam. There were over 10 of us going and the plan was to party and just have a good break from work. I chose Manofa Hotel because: it was centrally loacted/it was fairly cheap/it had rooms available. Now I didnt expect too much as at this price in most central location you couldnt get anything else, well I wasnt wrong... Hotel itself is located very well on Damrak main tourist place in Amsterdam. Staff was very friendly and helpful, and the price was nice as well - also have to mention that rooms were cleaned every day so a plus for that! All the positive things to say end there, rooms are tiny and in poor condition. All of them must have been decorated in the 40's (see the picture) and to make it look like from a cheap horror movie everything is lit by only one 40W bulb to give the room that unforgetable yellowish glow. All other lights were not working. Also we were given a room right in the corned in the back - supposed to be the quiet part of the hotel. Well if that was the quiet one then I dont want to see the ones in front of the building. If you are into barely lit old hotel rooms where you can listen to hard sex arguing and puking all nite long then this is a place to be ;-)

Reviews.Title: “get what u pay for”
Reviews.Author: kingofpro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the ritz but its location and prices were good i knew it wasnt the best from the reviews i had read prior to going but all i was looking for was a clean bed and a decent shower and thats what i got i have to admit the room could have done with a make over. We did not have any mice trouble and niether did the other people that i spoke to maybe we were lucky!!! the staff were freindly, the food wasnt the best but then again ur paying cheap prices to stay in the heart of amsterdam. if ur looking for mod cons forget it

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I feared”
Reviews.Author: wulviken
Reviews.Content: Hotel Manofa is located in Damrak street, only a 500 meters from the central station. After what we have heard about this hotel in advance (rats everywhere and crappy rooms) we feared the worst. But it was not as bad as that. The first impression was very good, the staff was very friendly and the lobby was relatively nice. As most small hotels in Amsterdam it was quite narrow and the hallways and stairs suffered from that. Small and narrow. The rooms were OK, but smelled kind of funky, a weired mixture of alcohol and old socks... Another thing was that there were almost no light in one of the rooms, probably because most of the light bulbs were disappeared.... In one of the lamps we also found a small bag of "something", perhaps magic mushrooms or an old space cake. Apart from this the rooms seemed to be just fine! Except for the mouse and rats of course, we heard them every night, but we never saw them. When we looked beneath the wardrobe we saw a lot of mouse crap which did not look very nice. But the room had no mouse holes or any other small holes so I doubt that those small [-] could get in to the room itself, they keep in the walls. The best thing about the hotel was the location, close to the red light district, central station and dam square. The price was also very good, we paid 515 euro for five persons for three nights. The worst things were the smelly rooms which seemed to be out of air every morning, even with open windows and the missing light bulbs during the whole stay. The mice did not bother us, but it could be kind of creepy for more sensitive people. It is most certainly NOT the place you bring your girlfriend for a romantic stay. But for people who want to party and do not care about if or where they sleep, it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “twas grand!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eyelashmcd
Reviews.Content: was grand! staff were friendly and hotel was grand!! there was no mice!!

Reviews.Title: “If ever the phrase "you get what you pay for" rang any truer...”
Reviews.Author: WilliWonka
Reviews.Content: Two great things about this hotel: The Location, The Price. I have nothing else good to say about it! I figured that I would 'go budget' as I had the evening planned and new that all I needed was a clean bed to lie in for a few hours. This was the cheapest deal on a reputable website. Wish I had read the reviews first. It wasn't worth the pittance I paid for it! Tiny room (about as tall as me) room maybe one foot longer than the bed, horrible plain wallpaper, plastic garden furniture chair, tiny bathroom, blocked sink, bad smell, make your own bed..... Horrible lay out to the hotel too - it felt like a fire trap. And the rest of the clientelle seemed to be in Amsterdam just to get stoned judging by their eyes. Spend a few Euro's more and go somewhere less dingy.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad at All.”
Reviews.Author: NoDoubterChris
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews about this place, I've decided to write my own. I just got back from 5 weeks in Europe. This place was actually one of our favorites. First of all, no, it isn't the best place to stay at. If you are traveling though, shouldn't you be out of your room exploring. We basically just used the place to sleep and bathe. The breakfast was decent compared to all other places we stayed at. It was as many bread rolls, meat, cheese, eggs, jam, coffee, oj, apple j as you wanted. There were no mice of any sorts throughout the place. The room we had booked was occupied so they ended up putting us on the very top room. It was great. Very roomy, beds were clean and comfy. We had a sink in the room and bathroom in the hall. The decorations weren't nice but who needs decorations in a hotel when you have a gorgeous city all around you. The people at the front desk were extremely nice and helful. Our friend got sick on our stay and the lady managed to get a doctor to come to us. This is a great place for younger adults or adults who don't plan on staying in their room the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Manofa - good in parts”
Reviews.Author: Scotsguy5
Reviews.Content: Hotel had great location on Damrak but would be more suited to young people who don't care what the hotel is like. The staff were very friendly -breakfast was OK in the restaurant below. Carpets in the hotel were stained and the corridors quite smelly. The room was dingy - few lights worked - light switches loose - bathroom hairdryer had bare wires and was held together with insulating tape. No toiletries provided, except a soap dispenser of the type you expect in public toilets. Beds were clean - housekeeping came every day but youwere only allowed ne towel each and no bath mat. The floor in the room was laminated but had spaces where it had moved due to poor fitting. if you are a back packer or a young couple just looking for VERY basic this hotel is fine. Older people or special visits dont go here. Can't comment on stairs as we were on first floor - which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hell”
Reviews.Author: BelfastBro
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sisters and niece have just returned from 3 days at this hotel and i would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone no matter how desperate you are. When we got there and checked in and climbed 4 flights of stairs the room was alright (old fashioned and a bit smelly)and was prepared to stay there until a mouse ran over my foot. We went to reception and the girl was nice enough and moved us to another room. I know this is a budget hotel (all we could get) but i would definitely spend more money next time for a better hotel. Had previously stayed in the Ramada last year in one of their star rooms this hotel was fab would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very much a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: bongo1st
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the 24th Aug 2007 for 3 nights, having read the previous reviews I can honestly say that they are pretty correct on what they say. The hotel recepionist were pleasant, the bed linen and towels were clean, the towels were changed every day. The stairs were very steep and winding and on the the 3rd floor where we were staying the sairs there had no carpet, on the landing there was a hole in he floor in one of the corners. During our stay we had a visit from mice, although we didn`t see them a packet of unopened biscuits had been opened with teeth marks in them, the room itself was pretty shabby stains on the wall grafitti in the wardrobe although shower was ok with hot water . Oh forgot to mention avoid the breakfast, you have been warned I was on a stag weekend with a group of 10 other lads so luckily i didn`t spend much time in the room, so although the hotel was terrible the location was pretty good, 200yards from central station and 2minute walk to the bars etc in the red light area. So if you have a very low budget and don`t mind steep stairs, extra guests (mice) and shabby rooms then go right ahead but for me I would look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as imagined.”
Reviews.Author: dankevel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Manofa. Having read the previous reviews atfer I had booked, was a bit worried about what I would find. The hotel is easy to find just a couple of minutes walk from central station. The receptionist on arrival was very pleasant and welcomed us to the hotel. The stairs going up to the room were very steep and winding but there was no loose carpet. The carpet on the landings did have some weird stains and needed to be replaced. Our room was on the top floor. We had a room with 3 single beds and en suite bathroom. We had satelite tv. The sheets and towels were very clean and changed daily. Wooden floors in the room which were clean. No sign of any rats or other creatures. I would not reccommend this hotel for a romantic break but for somewhere to sleep after a busy day in Amsterdam its fine.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: JOJOJOUk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Manofa, Damrak? Avoid at all costs. The photos on the website are completely different from the gross room we stayed in. Electricity cut out on the last night so we were in complete darkness with no TV and no shower on our level. Staff didnt want to hear about it. I cant believe theyre still in business. People must be desperate!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel in the World”
Reviews.Author: Paul_daly
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this Hotel! I booked this hotel directly with their website. When we saw the room we could not believe our eyes. The level of hygiene was awful. We refused to stay in this hotel and tried to get our money back but the hotel refused! If we had booked with a hotel agency we would have been able to reclaim some of the money but since we booked directly they refused. We have travelled to many places in the world and have stayed in many low budget places. But if I was given the room for free I still would not have stayed there!! So donâ€™t ruin your holiday in this filth pit. Rude and ignorant staff do not help its reputation! Dr. P Daly

Reviews.Title: “this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: TUGBOATANNIE
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights . On the second night we had water coming through the ceiling from the shower unit of the people in the room above,we were on the first floor. The rooms were very basic and my husband said it was like a kennel. The bedding and towels were clean its only saving grace. would not reccomend this hotel to anyone. The stairs to each floor were dangerous. The only reason we stayed was we only had 2 nights in amsterdam and after our journey did not want to start looking for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Nick1122
Reviews.Content: This place is wicked, cant see why people are going on about mice i couldnt see anything. Actually a clean place and good location and worth what i paid for it!

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly bad, stay away”
Reviews.Author: Mat789
Reviews.Content: My title sais it all, wouldnt like to waste any more time explaining how bad this place is, would not let the dog sleep on their beds, on booking I thought the location (its only good point) might make up for much of the bed press, it didnt, nearly the worst dive I ever stayed in, certainly is by price, and I have spend much time in the 3rd world, STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghButterfly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from the 23 april until 26 april. Was a bit paranoid after reading other reviews but thought one persons review out of 50, 60 people that stay their every week might not give the best overview. My partner and me had the room right behind the reception desk cant remember number. This was great as we did not need to climb those dreaded stairs. A bit on the noisey side but we just put tv on to drown out any noise. After spending most of our time in the coffee shops i think they could have had a party on the landing and we wouldnt have bothered. ON the whole the room is worth what you pay clean but basic. Cant comment on breakfast didnt make it on time.

Reviews.Title: “in the dam”
Reviews.Author: janabananatorquay
Reviews.Content: the staircase was narrow in places and dangerous.Our room,401 was adequate but with no t.v. or safe as promised when booked.There were 4 potential areas by my bed to seriously bang your head,the main one being a work-top with a square sharp corner right above my pillow.The shower was broken and very temperamental (boilng hot or very tepid).Breakfast was poor, rolls a mouthful,coffee served in a carafe andstaff completely unattentive.However the reception team wre very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I dont usual believe review...but believe these”
Reviews.Author: lainy568
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3night stay in the manofa. I had read these reviews before i left and didnt take them too seriously as mostly all reviews are bad, maybe 1 out of 1000 stays etc...but after arrivin in our very shabby room, which had no sun light getting in as it was facing an ally, which i could put up with the fact that it got cleaned once i can put up with for a 1 star hotel, but having to share my room with mice i cannot put up with. On our last night we seen a mouse runnin around the room and behind the radiator, and after the guy from reception came and tried to scare it away because "sorry we have no rooms avilable to move you" we had to stay in the room that night with mice that came back after the hotel guy had went away! So i decided to speak to the manager of the hotel in the morning to be told its "a common problem in amsterdam" hmmmmm maybe in the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: finkfloydman
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed at the Manofa for just one night. We are regular travellers to Amsterdam as we are English Ajax supporters. This was the first time we had used this hotel as we got a great rate using easy to book.com 25 euro's each for the night. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and allowed us to leave our bags in reception as we had a late flight back. The room was very basic but clean and functional. Beds were clean and comfortable and I could find no evidence of nasty little creatures. The toilet/shower room was clean and soap was provided. The water was hot and powerful. The only bizarre thing in our room was the big step up from the bedroom into the toilet, it was around 12 inches in height so if you have had a few beers watch it!. The breakfast was a bit of a disappointment even for a Euro buffet. Usual fare of cold meats and cheese etc. Rolls were in plastic toy boxes and were quite heavy and as other reviewers pointed out, you had to take pot luck with the coffee as it was served up in a carafe and went like lightening. We didn't get any. Also, what food there was soon ran out and wasn't replaced so if you have had a bit of a late night you were going to be out of luck. At 10 o'clock everything was cleared away in an instant. Still, I guess we couldn't complain too much for 25 euro's. The hotels big plus point is it's location. Right on the Damrak a stones throw from Centraal station, the red light district and Dam square. So would we stay here again? Yes probably if we got the same rate but no more than a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: Christine1984
Reviews.Content: Well i was dreading going to Hotel Manofa, most of the reviews were awful, but our stay was surprisingly nice. We stayed on the second floor in a Quad room, which wasnt't huge, but seens as we were only there for 3 days it was sufficient to our needs. The room was clean and smelt ok and the beds were freshly made. We didnt sample the food from downstairs as we were not up in time!!!!!!!!!!! The staff at the hotel were very friendly and seemed happy to help, they were also do not mind you leaving your cases there on the day you leave. We weren't flying out till 10 at night, but we kept our cases in reception all day. Also they have an iron that they dont mind you using. The location was perfect, we were close to everything (train station, fast food restaurants, Cafes, Canal rides, Pubs). I would definately go to Amsterdam again, and would stay in this Hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Scarily Bad Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Georgiarose
Reviews.Content: To be fair the location was excellent and the beds very comfy and the rooms were clean ( I did not check the mattress for bug activity). The room safes could not be used though so you had to leave stuff at reception. However the first night we were put in a room with two singles which can best be describes as a converted corridor. Room 215 more suitable for two blokes than a married middle aged couple. It was next to the stair well and the stairs were in constant use all night. Howvere the staff made every effort to move us to a more suitable room the following morning. The staff at this hotel are the jewels in the crown. They were excellent in every way. We had a late departure and they looked after our bag and kept our travel documents in the safe until we ready to leave Amsterdam. If the staff had not been so good I would have moved after the first night. Breakfast was interesting! It was served in the restaurant below the hotel and was as expected a basic bread rolls and cheese and ham. However whereas the hotel staff were excellent the reastaurant staff were awful. The rolls were keept in huge plastic toy box type containers and were mauled by all and sundry. The coffee was put in a wine carafe and not replenished until empty so you had to wait for an unsuspecting guest to empty the cold contents so you could grab a hot one. Plates were not put out and the presentation was shocking. I would only recommend this hotel to young people who are going to Amsterdam to party not for tourist type guests who may want to spend a few hours recharging their batteries in their hotel because this is one hotel you would not want to hang out at.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people make out”
Reviews.Author: bcairns
Reviews.Content: this is a good hotel to stay in IF theres 5 or 6 of you and you dont mind what its like aslong as theres clean sheets and a shower, we stayed for 3 nights and never encountered the dreaded bed bugs or any mice, even though there was food on the floor for 3 days straight, our room wasnt cleaned once but we did get clean towels when we asked, we had no problem bringing people up to the room either at all hours of the night. So if your goin away for a few days with a group of people on a bit of a session then the hotel manofa is perfect, i would not recommend it for anything else though.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe pictures on web site”
Reviews.Author: happyscouser
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the pictures on the web page,we were very disapointed when we arrived at the hotel. The inside was very shabby and smelly, i don't think the carpets had been cleaned for months.The room was very basic, but to be fair the bedding and towels were clean,the bath room was ok except for the shower curtian. The one thing the hotel did have to offer was a great location, you were only walking distance from all the main attractions. As others have said you only get what you pay for. But what a great place Amsterdam is!!! The happy scouser.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD!!”
Reviews.Author: musomartz
Reviews.Content: I have renamed this hotel The Hotel Manawful!! The decor in this hotel is very, very shabby. Sorry, that is an understatement. There are cleanliness issues and the room I stayed in was as basic as I have ever experienced. The furniture was old and falling apart, the beds had no headboards and bed bases were uncovered and grubby. If you are scared of lifts then come here! You can climb it's many twisting, narrow staircases all day! Not all rooms have en suite bathrooms, mine did fortunately! On the positive side it is central and the pillows were very soft. My room was facing the front onto main street which was noisy but it didn't bother me much. If you want no frills and the backpackers appeal that this hotel has then this is the place for you. It is cheap but I don't think it represents value for money. Check out fire exits and escape route.

Reviews.Title: “Mice”
Reviews.Author: duffnuts
Reviews.Content: The only thing this place had going for it was a decent Dutch breakfast in the morning. The rooms look good, but don't be surprised to wake up to mice running around the room, on the window sills, or even on the beds! I would suggest finding another place to stay, unless you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “If you like little animals....”
Reviews.Author: Hungara
Reviews.Content: THERE WAS A RAT IN OUR ROOM!!! And I've read that other people have seen rats too....so...I don't recomend this hotel at all! For the money I paid it was ok, not dirty and well situated...the breakfast (jam and cheese sandwiches, cereals, toasts...) was ok...but...I don't like rats so much...If you don't mind to sleep with little animals...

Reviews.Title: “ahhh...ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did not have reservations for a hotel when I arrived in Amsterdam. Manofa was the first hotel I found with a decent price in a good location. My room was luckily on the first floor. The room itself was small and smelled of saltwater or sweat the television did not work and the only view was of an alley. The wc was public and extremely cramped. The shower took a very long time to get hot and the area in front of the shower there was about four inches of water you had to tip-toe through at all times. The staff was extremely friendly throughout the night. I had terrible jet-lag and met most of the employees. As I stayed only one night, I did not meet this dreaded cleaning person, nor did I encounter any mice, rats, or roaches. All in all just hotel was just ok, not special. I would advise only young people to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Oh my god where do i start. There were 4 flights of stairs, no elevators. When we did manage to climb to the room i was disgusted.It wasn't fit for dogs. the rooms were small, smelled of must and looked like a place ud see on TV where some drug deal was goin down..The sheets were white with brown the same as the towels. when the windows were cosed there was still an inch of a gap between them and the frame. There was no fire escape where we were on the 4th flour and outside the window were boards with nails, so if the smoke didn't kill ya the nails would. i have never seen anything like this before. We got our money back thankfully with no questions asked after seeing 3 more rooms which were the same. The receptionist handed over the money like this wasn't the first time.and after all that when i come home i find they have deducted 95 euros from my credit card.NOT IMPRESSED. So be warned people please stay away. this place should be closed down

Reviews.Title: “Middle of May - 6 Days”
Reviews.Author: Lamer
Reviews.Content: The stay was okay, just remember sometimes you get what you pay for. I had booked 6 nights here and was very concerned after reading some of the posts, no doubt some folks did not have a good stay here. The staff was okay, helpful. The room I stayed in (112) was a single and very small, see the photos. Very dark due to the interior color and only one window facing into an alley. See the photos attached. The room was very small, but comfortable for me. The room was cleaned every day, except the ones where I had the sign on the door, "Do Not Disturb", even then I still caught the cleaning man and got a clean towel when needed, no problems. Only one towel is provided, no wash cloth, no matter I always take a shower sponge with me and throw it away at the end of the trip. The water does go hot/cold from time to time. Noise level was quite high well into the night, after all the folks have cleared the Damrak then you can hear clean up taking place, trash bins being dragged along, etc. It should be expected staying on the Damrak, nothing to be done about that. No mice, bugs, or rats in 6 nights of staying here. Nothing was stolen from my room, kept everything of value locked in the suitcase when I was out, the safe does not work. Just remember if you are looking for a deluxe motel, this one isn't it. If you need a place to shower/sleep and don't mind a bit of noise then this one is it. Nice central location, easy walk from Central Station, can get a Tram close by to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Its alright....but there are mice”
Reviews.Author: lankeymarlon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 6th - 11th of April 2006. After booking this hotel i found this site and started reading all the reviews before i went on holiday, and was totally regretting my purchase. It got so bad that even one of my friends threatened no to go as these reviews were so bad. Anyways we managed to convince him to come. I went with 4 friends(all male and under 20)and as it was the first time we were all on holiday without parents, we were a bit anxious. When we stepped off the train at Central Station we realised none of us actually knew where the hotel was. We traveled down most of the main roads and found the hotel after about 40 minutes. (Its not far at all just go left when you go out the front doors and walk down the biggest road.) When we got to the reception, all though everything was fine with the booking, both receptionists that were working at the time were very moody and were not at all helpful or cheerful. Turned out our room was on the top floor(I think it was 415). The hike up the stairs takes it out of you and especially when full of beer. The room itself was alright, everything was clean and spacious and although there was 5 of us we had six beds, dont know why???? The view from our window showed the entire Damrakk, good spot for smoking a joint just as you go to bed. The room looked like it had just been given the quickest of coats in the most horrible orange colour. Toilets are very small and for some reason on the top floor one toilet can be used by both males and females and another can be used by just females. I took 2 poos in the girls toilets as i didnt see why they should be any different from us blokes. The showers are a bit unpredictable sometimes cold, but if you get in when they are warm its nice a bit of mould on the ceiling and try to take the least amount of things into the showers with you as puddles collect on the floor. Its safe to say that i dont think that there was any bed bugs as i didnt feel any bites and have come away spot free. However like the previous reviewer stated there are mice. We didnt notice them the first 3 nights, but the first night that i didnt drink alcohol i was kept up till about 6 'o clock. Heard some rustling near the bin, switched on the light and there were two mice on the floor. Sorry no pictorial evidence as they are fast little rodents. My tip is thought if you do eat food in you room try to make as little mess as possible and put all your rubbish in the bin and just before you go to sleep, tie up the bin and put it outside. The cleaner is a total tool. He knocks on your door and as soon as you open it he runs in and starts shouting for you to get up, so if you have the balls just tell him to piss off. He seemed to wear the same clothes everyday - not very clean. I think the higher your room is the later you will have your room cleaned, as we were on the top floor we got out rooms cleaned everyday at about 1 o'clock. Also i got revenge as i spewed into the sink that was in our room and he had to unblock it. Rock n roll. The only thing that went missing while we were there, was a girls pair of shoes who was invited back to our room. One of my mates ended up giving her a pair of skating shoes, as none of the staff were helpful. Ok well i hope this review was helpful, i will probably stay there again as its cheap as chips and i dont mind mice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Show”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At first i was surprised when we arrived as the room had no traces of bugs or anything unwanted. Until 3rd and 4th night when we saw two rats scurrying around the room. When notified the cleaner he just told us that it was an old building so that was to be expected. Breakfast quite rubbish, ended up making cheese and ham rolls when i bothered going. Beer at bar very expensive. No TV in room as was advertised and no safe deposit box. Me and my friends just carried anything of value with us at all times as past reviews had told of things going missing. Definitely won't be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Mice, Mice, Mice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do i start??? Three friends, my partner and I stayed in this hotel from the 30th March till the 3rd April. We had made changes to our booking and had this confirmed by the hotel manager. Upon arrival, we were informed that we had only been allocated a four bedroom room, for the five of us! They did reduce the cost slightly, but this shouldnt have happened in the first place. So, we go upto our room, 211, and the first thing that strikes you is the fact that the hotel looks nothing like it does in the pictures on the website. The lights next to the mirror on the wall did not work and the safe under the table, had no code to open. We were slightly annoyed the following morning by the obnoxious cleaner that knocks on your door at 10am so that he can clean our room. This was most annoying as on a break you should be able to have a lie-in and the cleaners should come in when you have left of your own accord! Upon returning to our room later that same day all of our bags and clothes had been moved accross the room and my friend had had 70 Euros taken out of his hold all in the bed room. We searched high and low and could not find this money and could only put it down to the cleaners helping themselves to a tip!!!! Obviously, after this we carried all of our valuables on us, but how safe do YOU feel walking through the City of Amsterdam with your wallet/cash and passport all upon your person. On the second day we were moved to room 300, up another flight of steep, crooked stairs, this room was bigger and to pay the hotel a small compliment, the towels and bed linen was changed daily. This room was a little better, (so we thought), as it was slightly larger and my partner and I could seperate a bed away from my friends! But, that evening after being in town we returned with a takeaway, to mop up the excess alcohol in our systems! We had all settled down and most of us were asleep, when my partner started hearing noises near the Takeaway packages. She awoke myself and my friend and we sat up listening, there was a rustling sound. We just sat on our bedas looking at this paper bag moving on the side, when all of a sudden a mouse fell out of the bag and scuttled accross the floor. This scared my partner immensely and she did not sleep a wink that night, which also meant that neither did I! The following morning at 7am I went to the reception and informed them that we had mice in our room and they really didnt seem phased. It was as though this was a regular occurrance and that i was just another one that was complaining! The people on the reception informed me that they could change us rooms but they could not guarentee that this would not happen again, as Amsterdam is built around so much water! I was not happy but didnt really have any choice as we had already paid for this hotel! I returned to my room to break the news to my friends that there is not much they can do, when the obnoxious cleaner turned up and filled the hole that he thought the mice were coming out of with pollyfiller. We tried to inform this gentleman that we thought that they were coming from behind the radiators and he just laughed and said that mice are all over Amsterdam. The following evening, i was obviously shattered as i had had no sleep the night before, my friend could not sleep as he had seen the mice again, personnally i did not see them this night, but by the shattered look on my friends face i could tell that he had been awake all night! The restaurant was nice, but the breakfast was not, we only utilised the services for a coffee in the morning to get us through the resty of the day due to extreme tiredness. All in all, i would not stay in this hotel again, i came away from my weekend break more tired than when we went. Thoroughly dishappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Tripadvsr
Reviews.Content: I was reading the other reviews posted about this hotel, especially the ones that said it was not so bad, and had to add my own, especially as the problems with this hotel are serious. Upon arriving at the Amsterdam train station, we were approached by a man offering a hotel with good prices. The hotel had an impossible staircase if you have luggage that can not be easily carried. We got to our room (big windows, no curtains) which was oddly furnished with old beds, and began unpacking. Within an hour or so, we noticed the bed bugs. Although they are not suppose to come out until later at night, they were evidently hungry as they were everywhere! We immediately packed up, and got out of there as fast as we could. We went to the reception, and asked for our two nights money back. They said that they were not going to do this, despite the hotel being infested. We managed to get one night's refund, but only manually written on a slip, as they would not process it right away and told us that this was how it would be done. We were moved to another wing (the stairs again) which seemed okay. We were also told to check through our luggage to make sure we did not have any bugs in it, which we did. However, as bed bugs spread rapidly, I am not sure that this wing of the hotel will stay clean, especially if they move guests from one to the other. As we were exhausted from the moving, we barely saw Amsterdam that day. When we arrived home, within a few weeks, something began to bite during the night. The bugs had gotten into my luggage, and I managed to carry the infestation home with me. To add to that, the refund was never put through on my credit card! Overall, the stay cost us endless amounts of energy ( took a month to rid my house of the bugs)and worry and even more money (exterminator, no refund...). DO NOT GO TO THIS INFESTED HOTEL! The people who claimed it was okay got lucky. It is in no way worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel ( But Please Note Following)”
Reviews.Author: ThomasDells
Reviews.Content: Hotel Manofa ( Jan 13th - Mon 16th) After reading several reviews on this site me and a mate were a tad paranoid about the bed bugs and security of hotel. We had booked 2 rooms and when we arrived at hotel in evening we were allowed to view room 217 to see what it was like. First impressions of hotel were that it is very basic but I also felt that some of the reviews on this site were a bit harsh. Me and my mate went to work on checking the beds for bugs although we didnt find any the sheets did have a few holes in and black marks and odd staines in some places. We did find some evidence of bug infestation on the panelling / skirting boards there were black marks and evidence of bugs esp on the ceiling where my mate had taken a photo of a dead bug. Having said this none of our group of 7 had any bites / inflammation / boils on their skin. The bathrooms were very clean my bathroom in 211 was basic but the shower worked fine and wash basin was clean although there was a door in bathroom which we swear we could hear someone behind view out of window showed there was infact a room there which was a bit creepy as on several occasions we heard movement. There was no curtain on one of the windows but we soon fixed this by making a make shift one out of a spare sheet. The rooms had a quite strong smell of bleach which can be overpowering at first. Room 211 is very noisy we could hear noise from street and alleyway and doors slamming all nite. The cleaners are very noisy and knock on the door at around 9:30am they seemed to be a bit annoyed that we wernt out of rooms but after 2 days they just knocked and asked if we needed anything. I found the staff on reception to be very friendly and disagree with what other people have said on other reviews. Regarding previous reviews stating about security in hotel although none of us had anything stolen i feel i would be unhappy leaving anything valuable in the room the staff seemed very interested in when we would be going out and I would recommend keepng all passports / money / valuables under your pillow whilst asleep. This holiday was a lads one so we were too hungover / tired to make breakfast so i will rate the hotel as follows Reception staff ( 4 out of 5) Cleaning staff (1 out of 5) - Rude, Arrogent, Noisy Beds / bedding ( 1 out of 5 - Uncomfortable, holes in sheets, weird staines Bathroom (4 out of 5) Location (5 out of 5) Furnishings ( 1 out of 5) - Dirty , evidence of bugs, smelly, dodgy wiring for tv Hotel Corridor ( 1 out of 5 weird smell almost makes you throw up and staines on carpets) Value For Money (4 out of 5) - good but very basic bedding could be better Overall 2 out of 5 this hotel is a great budget place to stay it is very basic and i would only recommend it to stag nites / lads holidays and the budget traveller. I had a great time in amsterdam I would like to mention although i experienced no major problems i will not be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 groups, Bad for safety,Cheap,Location great, 3/5”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd already booked my stay at Hotel Manofa & just 2 days before i'd planned to leave (with not enough time to cancel), i thought i'd check out the reviews for it & i found travel advisor... After reading what everyone had put, i was completely dreading coming to stay, what with me & another friend seeing reports of bed bugs, doors not working, shady people coming in & out,rats, passports stolen etc I'd booked a long weekend (13th-16th Jan) for my birthday weekend with me & 6 friends, we stayed in rooms 211 & 217 (2 x quad rooms)which were fine apart from a strange locked room in the bathroom, that i'm sure i heard someone in, which could have access to the bedroom....? We made sure as soon as we arrived that we checked out our rooms from top to bottom, as there was NO WAY i was going to get lumbered with a room after i'd paid, but they/we were quite happy to agree after seeing that we'd got rooms looking quite-like the ones in the photos, although i've read they keep those empty! I'd of prefered to of kept are keycards on us, but maybe they've had problems with people loosing them in the past? My friends must have thought i was completely mad/nutty the amount of searching i did in my room, but there was no way i was going to end up with bites like in those photos from earlier in the reviews I searched high & low (using my camera phone light) but couldnt find any alive bed bugs (although u could clearly see where they had been, & a dead one as on our celling, which was worrying as it was! People were walking in & out of the hotel, like it was a public toliet, no one ever asked if we were staying there, but i told my friends not to take any chances, we took out passports out everywhere we went, also made sure all our bags had locks/padlocks on. We didn't feel safe in the hotel, which was are main concern of the weekend, we shouldn't have to worry! The hotel is in such a great location & lucky for us, we had an amazing weekend, we paid Â£17 a night each so overall we couldn't complain. The stairs really weren't as bad as people make out, even with me having the biggest case, guess being on the 2nd floor had it's advantages. The allyway however, was very nosey, it sounded like people fighting & things being dragged along (huge bins?) one after another, at about 5AM in morning! None of my friends made it up on time for breakfast, so i can't comment on that, from sound of other reviews, it's worth missing anyhow, & u can get a full english from one of the restaurants just outside. For a group of friends, i'd say the Manofa is fine, its cheap, it's in great location (for RLD, Dam square etc) & we didn't have problems! Just dont't bring expensive items with you to the hotel, ur only worry about their safety, check out the rooms BEFORE you pay, so u know what your getting first, take ur passports along with you out & pull ur bed off the wall, or sleep with clothes on, like me (just incase those little buggers were in our room!) I've included some photos, give people a better idea of what to expect :)

Reviews.Title: “They're not our doors!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel Manofa was unfortunately the only available room in Amsterdam for New Year 2006 (after leaving it a bit late). 4 of us shared a room, should perhaps call it a dormitory on the top floor. On arrival we were asked to check the room, we had 15 minutes to decide if it was ok then make a full payment. OK? It was dirty, 3 of the 4 lights didn't work, both shared showers in the corridor were broken, but hey, it was the only available room in Amsterdam so I had to lie through my teeth snd pay 545 euros for three nights. 20 euros a night would have been too much! Got through 2 nights and had intended on going home on the 3rd as we had to book 3 nights minimum. We went to collect out bags from the room at 5.30pm as we had a ferry to catch. The key card wouldn't open the door, we had to go down 3 flights to reception to have the card remagnatised and each time it didn't work. Half an hour later reception decided to actually come up and try themselves, to no avail, after some fancy computer box that the manager came up with an hour later we were told that we couldn't get in until the following morning!! They gave us another dormitory (6 beds in this one) and we didn't have any clean clothes/wash stuff etc. Shame having to stay another night in Amsterdam I know but in the morning when we explained we had to pay for another ferry and an extra days parking and that we weren't happy they told us it wasn't their fault as it wasn't their doors!!! Hmmmmm, it was their hotel though surely. Anyway, its supposed to be a 2 star hotel. I've been in better hostels. The staff were unfriendly, the cleaner was noisy+++ and seemed determined that we would be vacating our rooms each day and letting himself into the room to ask us! The beds were awful, the curtain was hanging off, the decor looked like it had last seen a lick of paint in the 70's and as I said, both showers were broken. The toilets were clean though. Need I say more!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bigs and Fleas - a horror trip”
Reviews.Author: vivien007
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother stayed at Manofa Hotel from 7th till 9th August in the room number 114. The first night I already felt that billions of something I couldnâ€™t define at that time was jumping all over my entire body which didnâ€™t let me sleep almost the whole night. I reported it to a staff member next day in the evening of which he took a notice. We supposed that I could have an allergic reaction on the strong chemical cleaned bed sheets and duvet cover. During the whole stay I had the same feeling that there must be something on my body which had let me scratch all the time. We also found bed bugs in our beds of which I took some pictures to make sure these were really bed bugs and not other insects. We left the hotel and the same day my mother found her arms entirely bitten and became inflamed. The next day the same thing happened to me. The doctor stated bites of fleas on Monday 15th and emphasized that he has never seen such a thing before. He referred us to a vet where we had to buy some chemicals to kill all the fleas which had spread in both of our flats. We paid more then 160 euro only for the chemicals (I had to disinfect my flat twice)!!! In addition to that we were not allowed to go to work because of the infection danger which reduces our salaries. These were the most expensive short-holidays we ever had. After that we emailed to Hotel Manofa several times and they promised us to transfer the money back. They are still promising until today.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in a large, triple room. Clean(ish) but basic is the best description, and definitely not recommended if you're unable to climb large numbers of steep stairs. One of our party found a pubic hair in his bed on arriving, and our windows wouldn't shut completely. Unfortunately, this meant that I was awoken periodically by the clientele of the club opposite leaving in the early hours, the staff of the club emptying their bins and sweeping up an hour later, and the not unpleasant but loud sound of the carillon ringing first thing the following morning. I broke the shower on day 1 - I stepped back onto a tile only to find that it wasn't supported by anything. The tile split and the splinters dropped onto the ceiling of the floor beneath. Terrifying. The people next door were smoking some pretty heavy duty stuff, the smell of which permeated the whole corridor. For the area (among the most expensive in Amsterdam), the Manofa is relatively cheap. It's certainly nothing special, though. Best recommended for stag parties or anybody who wants somewhere central to crash and isn't that fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, But OK !! - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Edinburghbloke29
Reviews.Content: We were there on a Stag weekend 8 Lads, Rooms were basic but OK. Resturant Good. EXCELLENT LOCATION !! - only couple of minute walk from central station, everything is on your doorstep. Good for lads weekends or people that are OK with basic. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR - I WOULD stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Ever had Vomit on your room Curtain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The web site photos looked ace, but soon realised that the room kept "empty" by reception is the one used for the photos on the website. I had a hysterectomy end of March and could not carry my extremely small case (for this purpose) up to 34 steps to our room, up very narrow and winding staircases, and there was no one to help me either. Our room:Dried vomit on the curtain, which was reported resulted in the curtain being taken down and not replaced for the whole 3 nights remaining, so had to sleep with head covered to get any sleep, also some very "interesting" brown stains on the wall above the tv. The beds, if they can be called this, were only wide enough for my size 14 body to sleep with my hands behind my head. The mattresses, quilts and pillows were all dirty, and we all made a pact not to smell anything - so take a hint from us and take a bottle of Febreeze. All in all we had an absolutely fabulous weekend with all 5 of us sharing a room, but the cleaners' cupboard (if that is what it should be called) was outside our door and the cleaner was a very loud man with an obnoxious attitude when presented with any problems, and he did insist on keeping the hoover on just outside our door, although we could not find any evidence of the hoover "cleaning" anything! Great location and the restaurant food was brill although the staff had problems understanding our drinks requests. Breakfast worth missing.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with ideal location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a good location near many shops and bars. The rooms are basic but for the price not bad. Staff are very friendly and rooms are cleaned daily. This is an ideal hotel if you want a clean room which is close to many attractions. Highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Was worried....but”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading some of the reviews since I booked before I checked this website. At the end of the day, all went ok. No bedbugs, clean rooms, clean bathrooms. Good service from staff. If you looking for 2 star you could do much worse than this place. Also located in the centre of all the action in very busy Damrak. Although, if your able, try and get a room away from the alley on the side of the building which can get a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Porridge revisited”
Reviews.Author: greeegash
Reviews.Content: 15 of us poor souls booked 5 budget rooms at this place. Opening the door to my cell (i mean room) i instantly felt a dark dark cloud fall over me. 1 bunk bed (complete with dirty yellow mattresses and pillows), 1 dirty sink, alot of graffiti and not alot else. Quickly deciding to escape for the night to any local bar the realisation soon dawned I would be returning after dark for a night of prison. The morning arrived and 1 of the group quickly nicknamed me and my roomate Godber and Fletch from the old porridge series and it wasn't hard to see why on our less than new metal bunk bed. The shared toilets and showers were in the same class as the room - awful, the shower was more a trickle of dirty water. I would highly recommnend you dont stay here, it is central but other freinds paid the same price on arrival at Ams airport and booked into a nice hotel round the corner with flat plasma screen t.v., own bathroom etc etc in their room. Luckily my sentance was 3 nights in this prison, but instead of feeling dirty and violated i implore you not to stay here at any cost!!

Reviews.Title: “Lout's Stag 3/4 Jun 05”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel if you accept you get what you pay for. Location is perfect for RLD, Teasers is a lively bar just down the road, also Tara (good Irish bar) further down on Rokin. Beds were clean, towels changed each day, no sign of bed bugs (despite extensive searching on arrival). Gets noisy in the morning with street cleaners so forget the lie in & go to Barney's in Jordaan (Haarlemerstraaat) for breakfast instead, much more fun (can I have some more pancakes with extra maple syrup please). Reception has safe deposit box if you need it. No complaints, hotel served it's purpose admirably. Be careful not to wander into attic late at night though as carpet is very damp. Dobsxxx

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great value for money for any groups looking for cheap accomodation in a Central location. Clean sheets and towels each day, helpful staff and breakfast thrown in (for anyone able to get up before 10a.m.)

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the bed bugs bite....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found this website and read the reviews the day before I arrived to stay for 7 nights and feared the worse. However for 65 Euro a night... Good Points : Got a single room on the first floor (reception floor) so the stairs weren't a problem New varnished and clean floorboards New and spotless ensuite shower and toilet Good TV choice (especially music channels) No mice or rodents Reasonably polite staff Excellent location Bad Points : A few bed bugs. Not bad enough to complain while I was there but the itching got worse after I returned home Window overlooked a very noisy alley to the side of the hotel. Arguments and fights in the early hours every night Sheets and towels were only changed once during the 7 night stay Three holes in the ceilings with exposed wires Very narrow room Very poor continental breakfast. Only had it the once as it wasn't worth getting up for Last year I stayed next door at Hotel Damrak. A bit more expensive (80 Euros a night for a single room) but only the breakfast and TV choice was poor. Everything else was better with an elevator and in-room fridge and safe. Good Argentinian Steak House as part of the hotel. Next year I'll book here.

Reviews.Title: “A Bloody Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay one night in Amsterdam before flying home- this hotel ruined the end of our trip- absolutely awful! The website can be very misleading- how I wish I had looked at tripadvisor before going! Steer clear!

Reviews.Title: “Drunk and Disorderly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind the constant noise of the drunken concert on the street, or the fact that the staff will send you away to look for a phantom hotel at 11 pm (even after you have shown them the confirmation with THEIR hotel name and address on it), you may consider your saftey when the people upstairs are stomping through the ceiling into your room. Not only were the staff and surroundings uncomfortable....so too was climb up the set of stairs (which look like something out of a horror flick) to get to the reception! With bags this was nearly impossible. LOOK ELSEWHERE PLEASE!!! Love your safety, sanitity, and comfort a bit more than to torture yourself with a stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Paid roughly 30 Euros per night which was just about the cheapest I could find, and got what was required - Good location, own bed, private bathroom and a perfectly acceptable standard of cleanliness. There wasnt much else, but who cares?

Reviews.Title: “Does the job if your young and only there for the craic.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience amsterdam and all you really want is from your accommodation is somewhere to keep your bits and pieces and collaspe after a rough night on the town, then manofa hotel is more than sufficient. Its cheap as they come and offers all the basics. Its not the most visually pleasing hotel you may find, but its location is pretty central, and during my four day stay there I didn't see a single rat. Not all that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DISwanzy
Reviews.Content: Man the Manofa is unbelievable!! I can't believe all the bad reviews. If you have been in Captain Lou's place or the Clearview Hotel you will know what a dump really is. Ok, so you walk into your room and either people have moved in or the porter is sitting watching womens volleyball on tv, but if you pay peanuts you get the Manofa. The panoramic views are among the best in central Amsterdam, and the Jacuzzi and Spa centre are great for soothing that dizzy head after sampling the cultural delights of one of Europe's great cities. By the way, there is a great Steak House just down from the Manofa (out front door and turn left, right beside Teasers Bar). Does great food and very reasonable prices - probably cheapest in Damrak Area. Try to get a seat at the front pavement, and the service is....... unbelievable. Enjoy your stay! Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: what a dump, the pictures on the site do not give a fair representation of this hotel. me and my wife arrived at the hotel had to climb about forty steps before we got in the hotel reception no help with our bags was provided. we then checked in we were on the top floor fourth floor again no help with bags (no lift) as we were about to enter the room the next room to us was blaring out music as loud as possible we entered our room there was no room to pass each other it was that small. one of the beds pillows had a hole in it there was a light not working the room was very dark there was a hole in the wall, a wire hanging down over the bed where a light should have been a wire hanging off the wall in the en-suite. we did not dare leave our things in the hotel we went to look for another hotel. we found the crowne plaza just around the corner a very nice hotel and for the same price we paid online!!! we went back to our hotel and checked out. the reception girl only said why didnt we asked to be moved to another room...my answer was what other room could you have put us in the place is a dump...her reply well we are only a 2star hotel...that is no exscue for holes in the wall, wires exposed and holes in the pillows and general cleanliness poor. i would not recommend this hotel to anybody i have stayed in better b&b's for less. the worst thing about the hotel is the safety issue we did not feel safe and dare not leave anything in the room. do not stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's not that bad....”
Reviews.Author: Sunsannah
Reviews.Content: Well, I've just got back from a 3 night stay at the Manofa. We booked it a week before and i happened to stumble across these reviews on the internet. Needless to say, I wasn't too keen on staying, but seems how we had to pay the first night, we went to see what it was like and planned on going somewhere else if these reviews were true. We were in a room for 4 on the second floor. There are lots of steep steps and no lift so don't go if you struggle with stairs. Don't take a haevy suitcase like me either. The bathroom was clean, so was the linen and the beds were fairly comfy. Fair enough, the building is old, but not falling to pieces or anything. The TV had music channels so we were happy with that. I think the rooms that share amentities on the lower floors are probably a bit worse, but ours was fine. We saw no rats and the staff assured us that they were brought in by a guest and that Rebnto-kil gor rid of them, so don't let that put you off!!The hotel is very close to the station and right in the middle of everything. The breakfast is a bit rubbish though, buns and ham and cheese, and if u leave it til 10 there might not be much left. oh, and I wouldn't pay for the 'Full English' wither as it was the worst cooked breakfast I've ever had.All in all, this an OK hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Manofa
HotelInfo.Address: Damrak 46-48, Amsterdam 1012 LL, The Netherlands
